loans.name: Tamutswa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-years-old Angeline from Harare. She is married with 5 children and only one is attending school. She does not look after any other dependents. Angeline is into manufacturing of footballs. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of adequate working capital and power shortages due to load shedding by the electricity supplier. 

Angeline has requested a loan of $750 to buy material for balls manufacturing and to be able to meet the demand. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future Angeline plans to open a retail shop in town for selling the balls that she produces.

loans.use: to purchase football material.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 23 years old, single, and supports two people. He runs a small-scale farming business and a retail shop in Bonjoge trading centre in Nandi County. He has been in business for the last two years and earns an average monthly income of Kshs. 35,000.

He plans to use the amount borrowed of Ksh. 25,000 to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to sustain himself and his dependents.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: El Sr. Félix tiene 57 años es conviviente con 4 hijos aun educando. En grupo cumple la función de secretario quine fue elegido por los demás socios del grupo “LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORCONA” hace 20 años  aperturo su restaurant que hasta hoy es su fuente de trabajo . En la actualidad tiene un nuevo objetivo en ampliar su restaurant con la venta de gaseosas y cerveza. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosa y cerveza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. El Sr. Félix es el primero del lado izquierdo. De la misma manera la Sra.  Modesta no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivo de encontrarse atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Félix is 57 years old and lives with his partner and his 4 school-age children. Félix was selected by his fellow members to serve the role of secretary for the group 'La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona' (The New Hope of Corcona). He opened his restaurant 20 years ago and it remains his source of work today. 

At present he has a new objective in expanding his restaurant to include the sale of soda and beer. This way he will earn a higher income. He will invest the loan in the purchase of soda and beer. 

Félix is pictured on the left. Modesta was not able to attend the meeting because she was tending to her customers. The group expresses its thanks to KIVA investors for providing the loan.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer.

loans.name: Avecillas Group

texts.es: Mayra es integrante del grupo avecillas, tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 16, 15, 12, 6 y 4 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de tacos de barbacoa en la vía publica, empezó desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, utilizará si crédito para dar mas surtido de comidas a su negocio. Un deseo que tiene Mayra es poner una carnicería en su casa.
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the group Avecillas. She's 33 years old, is married and has 5 children, aged 16, 15, 12, 6 and 4 years old. 

She sells barbecue tacos on the public thoroughfare and started doing so about 4 years ago. She will use her loan to have a wider variety of food for her business. Mayra would like to put a butcher shop in her home.

loans.use: to have a wider variety of food to sell

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es: Ilva, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua Laureles Sur, es una mujer trabajadora que siempre busca la manera de darles la educación a 2 de sus hijos que aun no han culminado sus estudios, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es conductor de transportes pesados. Ilva se apoya con su pequeño negocio para los diferentes gastos del hogar, por lo que siempre está pendiente de tener productos para vender. Solicita el crédito para invertir en productos de mayor demanda como granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Ilva is a resident of Laureles Sur a marginal neighborhood in Managua. She is a hard-working woman, always looking for a way to give an education to her two children who have not yet completed their studies. She has the support of her husband, who works as a heavy transport driver. 

Ilva supports the household expenses with her small business, so she's always on the lookout for products to sell. She's applying for the loan to invest in high-demand products, such as basic grains, dairy products, sweets, meat and other items.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, sweets, meat and other items.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, 38, is married with six children, three of them in school. 

Perla is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for three years. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Perla has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de un ternero para darle desarrollo y poderlo vender para carne. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto con un buen desarrollo y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener el animal y desarrollar un buen ternero para en el futuro venderlo para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alexis is 67 years old and married. He lives with his wife, who's his main priority. With his loan he intends to purchase a calf so that he can raise it and sell it for butchering. The idea is to make good use of the space he has for pasture, which is well developed, and of the good conditions of the soil and the weather. That way he'll be able to have the animal and raise a good calf in order to sell it for butchering later on. With this purchase he'll start another line of work and save some money at the same time, which will allow him to gradually have more animals and invest more in his land. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with easier repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 53, is married with three children. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for nine years. She also earns income from selling vegetables and food vending. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Helen has requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase sardines, breads, soap and other miscellaneous items.

Helen has already borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She aspires to saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sardines, breads, soap and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling and farming rice and coconut. Edelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, oil, noodles, rice, soap, groceries, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, oil, noodles, rice, soap, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 24 years old, single and supports his three siblings. He runs a retail shop in the Kipsigak location in Nandi County served by KADET LTD's Kapsabet office.

He has been in business for the last five years and he gets an average monthly income of 12,000 KES. He plans to use the amount borrowed of 20,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to repay his loan and in running the retail shop business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nelda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lope works hard to support her family.

She has a abaca (plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Lope is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

Lope successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her abaca weaving business.

Lope has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business still further.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Abdul Mutleb

texts.en:
Abdul Mutleb is an Iraqi client who is 35 years old and lives with his family consisting of 6 members. Abdul Mutleb, along with 4 of his brothers, provides the family income together.

He is a grocer and owns a small grocery shop where he sells snacks, tissue paper, toothpastes and soaps. He has been running this business since 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Abdul Mutleb is well-known in the area, with an excellent reputation.

Abdul Mutleb is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling, a rolling shutter and to buy a motor generator. Abdul Mutleb is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that one day he may open a bigger supermarket and provide more services for his neighborhood.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling, a rolling shutter and to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan, age 55, is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making springs which are used in motorbikes. She has been doing it for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Ramzan is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them.

In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Ramzan requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase bundles of steel wires and some cutters to increase production. She expects a boost in her earnings through her greater sales and aspires to save money for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of steel wires and some cutters

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and only sibling. His father is the main income source for the family and he cooperates with him to be able to satisfy the family’s needs. 

Mohamad is working as a construction worker sticking with multiple projects and entrepreneurs. He is a hard worker who always seeks the best. With his requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase a winch which he will be using to carry on with his operations properly. 

In the future, Mohamad plans to open his own office where he will make more contracts and agreements and therefore earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a winch

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 26 years old, married to Lillian, and is blessed with two children, ages 2 and 5. Jacob is a tea farmer in Kipsigak and is served by the KADET Kapsabet Branch. 

He has been in this business for the last two years and gets a monthly income of 7,000 KES. He has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase tea seedlings. With the anticipated profits he will be able to pay his children's school fees as well as repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase tea seedlings

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andres, 29, is married and lives with his wife and child, who are his main priority.  With his loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides and pay for workers to help him with his coffee crops.  In addition, he will buy some seedlings to put in when the rains start.  His goal is to increase the density of his plants per area, also taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil and climate and other conditions that are favorable to the cultivation of coffee.  With these improvements, he hopes to obtain a bit more income and in this way improve his family's living conditions.  Also, he will invest a bit more in his land and also accomplish some other goals.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken loans from the state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor for his coffee crops

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 49 years old and married with four children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years. Elizabeth earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en:
Fehmeeda, 32, is married and the mother of three children. For about eight years, she is worked in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to build enough of a clientele that she is able to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees to buy spools of thread in different colors and packages of  beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. With these materials, she would be able to complete orders on time. 

Fehmeeda is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She dreams of a bright future for her children and hopes to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packages of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La señora Clotilde trabaja en una carpinteria, vive en alquiler con un acabado fino y piso  de machimbre, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Clotilde es ayudante de una carpinteria, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para la compra de una maquina  para la producción propia puertas de  y así mejorar su ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Clotilde es tener un taller de propio.
texts.en:
Clotilde works in a carpentry shop.  She lives in a rented house that has finishing touches and a tongue and groove floor.  Her home is located in the Bajo Irpavi neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Clotilde is a carpenter's assistant.   From this work, she generates income to cover the food, light and water expenses.  She needs this loan to buy a woodworking machine so that she can make doors.  This way, her income and quality of life will improve.

Clotilde's dream is to have her own workshop.

loans.use: to buy woodworking machinery to make doors

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, etc. desde hace 7 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old. She has worked selling women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, deodorants etc for the last 7 years as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods close to her residence. With the money she makes from her sales she has been able to get her family ahead. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children who are 14 and 17 years old. 

Ana needs this loan  to buy more merchandise wholesale in order to continue with her business and provide greater economic stability for her family

loans.use: to buy women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, deodorants etc. wholesale

loans.name: Benkan I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAN I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  KOROTOUMOU , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 190.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkan I group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Fanan, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows rice. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the market to both consumers and resellers. She is expecting to make a profit of 190,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es: Doña Jerobia, una señora trabajadora, que junto a sus hijos busca como salir adelante en la vida, hoy en día casi todos son mayores de edad e independientes a excepción de uno de 12 años quien aun está estudiando, comparte con su esposo los gastos del hogar. Ella continúa con la venta de ropa usada y nueva, siendo este su único medio de ingresos, solicita el crédito para invertir en variedades de ropa como pantalones, camisas y vestidos, para garantizar la venta del día.
texts.en:
Jerobia is a hard working woman who is looking to get ahead in life with her children. With the exception of the 12-year-old who is still studying, they now are all grown and independent and help her husband with the household expenses. 

Jerobia continues to sell new and used clothing, this being her only source of income. She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of clothing like pants, shirts and dresses in order to assure her continued sales.

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 39 years old, married with three children. Her spouse Peter helps in fending for the family, too. She is in the dairy farming business in Kapyagan, a location served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last eight years, and she gets an average monthly income of KES 10,000.

Leah has borrowed a loan of KES.10,000 and plans to use it to purchase animal feed. Her dream is to educate her children and to set up a zero grazing unit.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 46, is a married woman. She has been manufacturing buckles, which are used in the embellishment of shoes, for the past two years. She beautifully makes buckles with stones and pearls at home and then sells them in the local market. She has now attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase metal, such as brass and silver, along with packs of stones and pearls in various colors, to increase production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her larger sales. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Farzana wishes to utilize part of the revenue to provide good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of metal, such as brass and silver, along with packs of stones and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Abdul Razzak

texts.en:
Abdul Razzak is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married, and the father of five children. Abdul Razzak and three of his children contribute to the family income together.

Abdul Razzak owns a grocery store where he provides his neighborhood with all of their basic, home needs. He sells canned food, snacks, and dairy products. He established his business in 2010 and he now has a hired employee. Abdul Razzak became well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his respectful behavior with his clients.

Abdul Razzak is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy two new refrigerators and to install signage for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and to install signage for his grocery store

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 37 years old and a married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is very expert in stitching fashionable clothes and has retained a good customer list. She is a mother of seven and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She earns enough through her business to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons. She is in her second loan cycle. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a pig fattening business in the Philippines for ten years.

Rosana requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en: Gracelyn, 36 years old, is married and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Gracelyn operates a fishing venture. She sells fish, while her husband fishes for a living. She's been in this business for more than five years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. Recently, she requested  a loan of 40,000 PHP, which she plans to use to buy a new set of fishing nets. In 2011, Gracelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Gracelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of fishing nets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fruits to resell, like rambutans, mangoes, apples, oranges, and grapes. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell at her stand, like rambutans, mangoes, apples, oranges, and grapes

loans.name: Wihab

texts.en:
Wihab is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, and he has two wives and ten children. Wihab works hard to provide for the needs of his big family, all by himself. He owns a blacksmith's shop and specializes in making doors and windows. He has been in this field since his childhood, and he established his own business in 2010. He has good experience in this field and employs two people. He is well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices.

Wihab is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD, in order to buy a big motor generator. Wihab believes that this loan will help him to work overtime, in order to provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a big motor generator for use at his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have two children aged 10 and 12 years old. She runs a boutique shop in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last three years, generating a monthly income of approximately KES 70,000. Beth plans to use the KES 40,000 borrowed to purchase more bales of new clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from the boutique business to expand her boutique.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling vegetables and spices, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and spices to resell. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to resell

loans.name: Joelisa

texts.en:
Joelisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 27 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell at her store. Joelisa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Kasem works to provide the family income while his wife takes care of their children.

Kasem owns a library where he sells stationery and accessories and also provides printing services. He established his business in 2004 and has gained much experience in this field. Now, Kasem has a hired employee and is well known in the surrounding area.

Kasem is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD. He will use this loan to buy an air conditioner, a photocopier and some shelves to install in his library. Kasem is aiming to increase his profits so that he may educate his children.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a photocopier and some shelves to install in his library

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 64 years old, married and has nine children.  

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is 39 years old and married. She has five children. To make a living, she owns and manages a farm, growing calamansi and other fruits. (Calamansi is a citrus fruit native to the Philippines.)  She sells the produce of the land at a market in town, and she earns income for the basic needs of the family.

She has borrowed the amount of 16,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she had joined in 2001. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to cultivate the adjacent farm, in order to gain more profit for the better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, for growing calamansi and other fruits

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is married with three children to care for. She is 41 years old and lives in Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Virgie sells personal products such as fashion dresses, comforters and more. She has been operating this business for more than four years and earns 7000 PHP each month. 

In addition to doing this, she also helps her husband to manage their rice farm.

Recently, she has requested a loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC to buy fertilizer and pay land preparation costs. Virgie has been a member of the cooperative for two years. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to be more progressive in her venture and would like to expand her facility and product offerings to attract more customers. She plans to procure trendy items to meet the market's current demands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land preparation costs

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a root crop vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more root crops to sell.

Virgilia has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a general store.

Virgilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elvie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Emerita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and food vending.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Joseph Njenga

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old, married to Jane, and they have five children who are in school.

He has practiced farming in Olkalou for the past thirteen years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a cow after paying his previous loan on time. 

He has a monthly income of KES 30,000. He hopes to repay the loan and cater to the needs of his family with the anticipated profit.

Joseph hopes to educate his children and expand his dairy farming business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 33-year-old mother from Migori town, found in the western part of Kenya. She supports eight people in her family. She is married to Mwikabe, who is a businessman supporting his family. Mary has six children who are 14, 12, 9, 6, and 4 years old with the last one born being 4 months old.

Mary is a hawker, selling different kinds of commodities. She has been doing this for the last year and generates a monthly income of KES 18000. This is her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more goods, and the anticipated profit will help boost her business.

Mary's dream is to expand the business as well as positively change her life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase the stock.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas

Comercio

C 3000.000

El grupo cuenta con actividades consolidadas que le permiten tener una baja razón de deuda. El trabajo en equipo ha permitido tener un crecimiento importante en el patrimonio que ha traído beneficios a todas sus familias. Mantienen actividades de comercio manteniendo una buena calidad del producto y facilidades para sus  clientes.

Carmen ha sido una líder en la zona de Puntarenas para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 54 años de edad y vive con sus 3 hijos y tiene un nieto. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos, una de ellas es enfermera; además de agrupar mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras para apoyarlas con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer, siendo el único ingreso de la casa. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de catálogo y electrodomésticos, que va a comprar a un deposito libre, muy conocido en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, aprovechando la época donde hay muchos ingresos por aguinaldo y ahorros y la gente desea comprar artículos, ya se para regalar  o para auto regalarse, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado aprovecha. Carmen pertenece Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas y funge en el puesto de tesorera
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
Este es  un grupo consolidado, han trabajado con Fundación Mujer desde el año 2004, realizando, con esta, doce solicitudes de crédito, pasando por su grupo mas de 20 mujeres de la comunidad de Veinte de Noviembre en la zona de Puntarenas. Han demostrado trabajo, crecimiento, unión y solidaridad, su moral de pago ha sido. 


 El grupo ha demostrado una buena conducta de pago y ha renovado sus préstamos año a año, sus actividades están generando ingresos que les permiten viajar al exterior a comprar mercadería (Nicaragua y Panamá) contar con locales propios, maquinarias propias, y ofrecer una variada gama de productos en los lugares donde viven.
texts.en:
"Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas" (Growing Together Women’s Bank) is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 Costa Rican colones (CRC) for their businesses.  The group has consolidated activities that allow them to have a low debt ratio.  Teamwork has allowed them to have a significant growth in financial resources that has brought benefits to all of their families.  They maintain business activities keeping a good quality of product and ease for their customers.

Carmen has been a leader in the Puntarenas area in supporting women who want to better themselves and get ahead.  She lives in the "20 de Noviembre" neighborhood in Puntarenas, a place with a lot of poverty and social problems.  She is 54 years old and lives with her three children and she has one grandson.  With effort and work she has managed to give her children an education; one of them is a nurse.  She also brings together hardworking and enterprising women to support them with their loans from Fundación Mujer, being the only income-earners in their households.  

The objective of this loan is to purchase merchandise such as catalog products and household appliances that she is going to purchase in the duty-free shopping zone, well known in the southern part of Costa Rica, taking advantage of the season where there is a lot of income from bonuses and savings and people want to buy items, whether to give to others or to themselves, a situation that she, due to her experience and knowledge of the market, can make the most of.  Carmen belongs to the "Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas" and serves in the position of treasurer.

Standing out among her goals is getting ahead so that she and her children will have a better future, so that they can get an education, and she can have support so that her business grows more each day.  For now the greatest difficulty has been economic but she has found in this program a support for her small-business venture.

This is a strong group that has worked with Fundación Mujer since the year 2004, fulfilling, with this one, twelve loan requests, with more than 20 women from the community of "20 de Noviembre" in the area of Puntarenas having been involved in the group.  They have demonstrated work, growth, unity and solidarity and their payments have been good.  The group has demonstrated good payment conduct and has renewed their loans year after year.  Their activities are generating revenue that allows them to travel abroad to purchase merchandise (Nicaragua and Panamá).  They have their own establishments, their own equipment, and offer a wide range of products in the places where they live.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, clothing, perfumes, cosmetics and other things.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, of Alindahaw, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, is 41 years old, married and has seven children. To make a living, her husband goes fishing and she  buys and sells fish, selling it in the market in town. She has been doing this for more than five years and she gains enough for the family needs. In order to acquire a new set of fishing nets, she borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she had joined in 2009. She hopes to gain additional income to save a portion of it and it will help her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to acquire a new set of fishing nets

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, who is separated from her husband. She's from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Magdalina operates a gardening business to earn her living. She's been in this work for more than 14 years and she earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and chemicals

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Cheryl has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, who comes from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is 52 years old, married and has eight children. To make a living, she owns and manages her store selling goods in her local area. She has been doing this for many years while her husband does farming. In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services, Recently, she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, sugar and dairy products to sell. In the future, she plans to expand the business in order to provide better living conditions for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, sugar and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva, de 34 años de edad, esta casada con Rosendo quien es marino mercante. Juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia. Elva se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería en general como tubos, pegamentos, fierros, etc. Para eso cuenta con un local que instalo en el interior de su vivienda. Todas sus mercaderías las trae desde otra ciudad y las vende a precios competitivos logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes quienes la recomiendan  con otras personas, logrando tener muy buena clientela. Se inició hace más de 05 años en este negocio y considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos. Antes de iniciar su negocio no contaba con ingresos propios, por eso decidió contar con un oficio y así generar sus propios ingresos. Por tanto viendo los buenos resultados, desea en un futuro aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y ampliar su local. Este es su séptimo préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará artículos de ferretería al por mayor tales como tubos, pengamento, cemento , entre otros.
texts.en:
Elva is 34 years old and is married to Rosendo, who is a merchant marine.  They live together comfortably in their own house.  Elva works selling hardware store merchandise, including pipes, adhesive, iron, etc.  To this end, she has established a shop inside her house.  She gets all her merchandise from another city and sells it at competitive prices, earning the loyalty of her customers.  Her customers then recommend her to others and in this way she has established a good clientele.

Her business started more than 5 years ago and she considers it very fruitful due to the demand for her goods.  Before starting her business, she didn't have her own source of income.  For this reason, she decided to start working in this field and generate her own income.  Looking back on her success, she now desires to increase the amount of goods she sells and expand her business.

This is her 7th Kiva loan.  She hopes to use this partnership to put her plans into action.  For her part, she promises to make her payments on time.

With the amount requested (1000 sols or US$375), she will buy hardware store merchandise such as pipes, adhesive, cement, and other things.

loans.use: buy hardware store merchandise, including pipes, adhesive, cement, and other things.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita, 68, is a widow with four adult children. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a retail store at home to make a living. She's been running this business for more than 21 years now and earns about 3,200 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC. Now, she is requesting a new loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional goods like canned goods, spices and dairy products. She dreams of a business expansion someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell, like canned goods, spices, and dairy products

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Erma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Esperanza works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Esperanza is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional chicken, pork and beef to sell.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork and beef to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 54 years old and married with five children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like bread, detergent, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs and other groceries in her general store.

Consolacion has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling firewood.

Consolacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like bread, detergent, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: Don Pedro, un señor de avanzada edad, quien ha enfrentado muchas dificultades cumpliendo con su deber de guarda de seguridad, pero es su único medio de ingresos con lo que se ayuda para la manutención de dos de sus hijos, los que aun no se han independizado y que van a la escuela, su esposa es ama de casa. Con el crédito solicitado desea hacer una división de cuarto y cambiar algunas láminas del techo de su casa, para garantizar la seguridad en su hogar para la familia.
texts.en: Pedro is a man of advanced age who has faced many trials as he has fulfilled his duties as a security guard.  However, it is his only means of income, which he uses to care for his two children.  They are still dependent on him and go to school.  His wife is a housewife.  With the loan that he has asked for, he wants to divide a room in his house and replace some parts of his roof.  This will ensure the safety of his house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, sand, iron, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia works every day in her business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables. This allows her to meet her household expenses and pay for the education of her five children. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she offers a good quality of commodities to customers. Sylvia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional bananas, corn, cabbage and fish to sell. These will enable her to improve more her business and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas, corn, cabbage and fish to sell

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is 35 years old and married to Nashiluni M. Together they have four children between the ages of 4 and 11. For the last nine years, he has farmed his own piece of land to earn income. Nicodemus cultivates potatoes which have proven to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

Nicodemus learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his fourth loan. He plans to buy farm inputs that include fertilizer and pesticides. With the profits from the loan proceeds, Nicodemus plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more potatoes for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hard-working man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, 60, is a married woman with three children and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

For more than 22 years, Marcelina has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP from her business. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, spices and biscuits. Marcelina has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Marcelina wants to renovate her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, spices and biscuits for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Evelyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is in her early 20s, married and has two children, one in school and the other too young for school. She has been buying and selling vegetables for three years now.  She works from 5.00 a.m. to 5.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Mwanaidi's seventh loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her vegetable stock and has paid them all back successfully. She is really happy with the loans which have helped her to support her family to a good standard. The profits paid for her child's school fees, covered household expenses and allowed her to start building her house. She will use this loan to buy more vegetables to meet her customers' demand, selling door to door. She dreams of selling more vegetables.

Mwanaidi will share this loan with her loan group "Top Class" which has 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely, 24 years of age, helps her husband in earning an income through selling fish in their village. She also sells seafood. She is requesting a loan amounting to 6,000 PHP to purchase more fishes to sell. Through this loan, she knows that she will improve her earnings every day, so she hopes that her requested loan will be granted in order to improve her business. This will enable her to provide better allowances for her four children.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 29 years old and married with one child. He has a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo town and has been in this business for four years.

This is his third loan and he plans to use the new loan to start a business of selling spare parts especially for bicycles and motorcycles. He will also use part of the loan to service his motorcycle. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his child.

He hopes to grow his business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and also start a business selling spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 5. He has a phone accessories shop in Olkalau which he has operated for the past three years and also has a salon. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD. to enable him buy phone accessories. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. He hopes to expand his business with the anticipated profit.

He hopes to improve his family living standard and buy a plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en:
Lonkisa is a 46 years old, married to Naneu, and supports a family of ten members. His children are aged between six and nineteen years of age. He has farmed his own piece of land for the last five years to earn income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through a loan officer. This will be his fifth loan after successfully paying off the previous loans. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for spraying the wheat farm with pesticides. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams involve buying a bigger piece of land, planting more wheat for commercial farming, buying his own farm machinery, and educating his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on the goals he has set.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en:
Braulio is married and has three children. He is 39 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Braulio has been operating a farming business for more than 10 years. Each month, he earns PHP 4,000 from his business. He requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure and buy assorted varieties of seedlings.  In the future, he wants to save a portion of his profit as a reserve fund for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and buy assorted varieties of seedlings

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is 58 years old and is married with six children.

Matea is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Matea requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

Matea has been farming vegetables for 34 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm tools.

Elsa has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from her variety store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm tools.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a middle-aged Cameroonian living and doing business in an urban area. She is married with five children. The oldest is 21 years old studying business administration at the bachelor's level and the youngest is in primary school. She has been in the telecommunications business for the past six years which makes her experience very stable and also her business very profitable. She has a 70 percent chance of succeeding in this business. This loan will increase her output by 12 percent and hence her standard of living

loans.use: to pay for communication credit

loans.name: Desiré Karina

texts.es: Desiré de 31 años de edad, habita en un municipio muy cercano a la Capital de Atlántico. Allí se dedica al comercio de ropa, accesorios y artesanías en general, desde hace 2 años, cuando en el mes de Diciembre del año 2010, compró sus primeros calzados, accesorios y vestidos para venderle  a sus primeros  clientes, que poco a poco han ido recomendándole a otros, y ella con su buen servicio,  los ha convertido en sus fieles compradores. Desiré,  diariamente desde muy temprano, compra la mercancía a mayoristas del mercado, la clasifica y de acuerdo con el pedido responde a su clientela, mientras que sus compras   a minoristas,  las hace de acuerdo a las especificaciones y los pedidos que le hayan hecho. Ella vende de contado y a crédito, a sus clientes y estos a su vez, le pagan poco a poco cada producto. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local comercial y sacar adelante a su hija, dejándole su propio negocio. En la actualidad Desiré está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara productos artesanales, calzado y vestidos encargados por sus buenos clientes; ella espera recibir su credikiva para ser muy oportuna en su respuesta, porque su sueño es lograr reconocimiento a nivel comercial, esforzándose al máximo para hacer avanzar su negocio y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Desiré is 31 years old and lives in a city very close to the capital of Atlántico.  There, she works selling clothes, accessories, and general handcrafts.  Two years ago (December of 2010), she bought her first shoes, accessories, and clothing to sell to her first customers.  Little by little, they have been recommending her to others and she has made them her faithful customers due to her good service.

Desiré wakes up early every day, buys her goods wholesale in the market, sorts it, and responds to her customers based on her orders.  She sells retail according to the specifications and orders that have been made to her.  She accepts cash and also sells on credit, accepting payment little buy little for each good.

Her goal for the future is to have her own store and help her daughter progress, leaving her with her own business.

Currently, Desiré is asking for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loan, she will buy the handcrafts, shoes, and clothing that her good customers ask for.    She hopes to receive her Kiva loan and respond to it appropriately, because her dream is to obtain recognition in sales and do her best to help her business progress.  This is exactly what makes Kiva great.

loans.use: buy handcrafts, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is 28 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flores Marie is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her business.

Flores Marie has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from vegetable vending and furniture making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene 37 años, está separada y vive en la casa de su hermana junta sus dos hijos. Florinda se dedica a la venta de comida como regionales, trabaja de lunes a viernes por las noches en la esquina de su barrio en donde diariamente instala una mesa y algunas sillas. Atiende siempre muy amablemente a sus clientes por lo que ha logrado tener buena acogida y demanda. Le gusta cocinar pues aprendió de su madre los secretos culinarios. Realiza este negocio desde hace 16 años contando y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus mesas y sillas donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceites, entre otros para su restaurante.
texts.en: Florinda is 37 years old, separated, and lives in her sister's house along with her two children. Florinda sells traditional regional dishes. She works Monday through Friday evenings on the corner of her neighborhood where she sets up a table and chairs daily. She is friendly with her customers so she has been able to establish a welcoming environment and customer base. She likes to cook, she learned her mother's culinary secrets. She has been doing this business for 16 years and depends on her mother's help. She wishes to expand her business and improve her tables and chairs so she can make her customers more comfortable. She is seeking S/.2000, and is content to know that she has the economic support to continue forward to meet her goals. She promises to be punctual with every one of her payments. With the loan she will purchase rice, condiments, meat, oil, and other items for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments, meat and other items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has two children and has been doing this work for eight years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'Selling products and meeting people at the market'.  Her biggest challenge is 'animal pests and diseases.' The animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Cheche.'

Eunice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, 'Farmer incentives.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she replied, 'Grace period.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Eunice replied  'it will give better living standard.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eunice owns the following: a cow but no pigs, poultry, pumps, bicycles, motorcycles, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household  'a mosquito net and TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children who are all grown up.  She has five grandchildren and three of them go to school.  The other two are small.  She has been running a business of tie and dye for three years now.  She works from 8 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start making and selling tie and dye clothes called Vikoye.  Previously, she used to sell cooked food.  She is doing very well and is happy with the loan, which enables her to be self sufficient.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her three grandkids and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more rolls of materials and different type of colors for her tie and dye business.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "CRANE", which has 13. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of materials and different types of colors for her tie and dye business.

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PROGRESISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Ingrid ella es soltera y tiene 26 años; La socia altera sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institución pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta institución el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para dama para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agencia de viajes, venta de accesorios de celulares, transporte de carga, trabajadores para el sector publico,guia de turismo.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "Los Progresistas" (The Progressives).  This bank is located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Ingrid is a group member, is single, and is 26 years old.  She alternates working in public service and in another field.  She has been working in public service for a while and it has been going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts towards her work every day.  At the same time, she works selling shoes via catalog.  In this way, she is able to get ahead.

Ingrid is asking for a loan to buy women's shoes for her business.

The other group members work selling cell phone accessories, transporting goods, in the public sector, as a travel agent, and as a tour guide.

The group members who are in the attached photo asked permission to arrive at the meeting late due to work.

Ingrid is thankful to those that are a part of this dream in this way and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Frediswinda

texts.en:
Frediswinda is 64 years old and married with one child.
,
Frediswinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Frediswinda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Frediswinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 66 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial.  Esta casada con Uderico, tiene 03 hijos de 25, 23 y 18 quienes ya son independientes, por eso vive solo con su esposo en su casa propia. Dora se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora y un pequeño local  en el interior su vivienda, además de acondicionar el ambiente con música selecta y agradable al gusto de sus clientes, donde atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial. Le gustan su oficio ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos personales. Este es su séptimo crédito con Kiva y se siente contenta por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, por cajas y al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dora is 66 years old, is very hardworking, and has a great desire to progress.  In addition, she is kind and friendly.  She is married to Uderico and has 3 children (ages 25, 23, and 18) who are independent.  For this reason, she lives alone with her husband in their own house.  Dora works selling soft drinks.  For this, she has a refrigerator and a small shop in her house.  In addition to adjusting the atmosphere with select, pleasing music to make her customers happy, she assists her customers in a friendly and kind manner.  She likes her work because it allows her to be busy and have an income to help cover her personal expenses.

This is her 7th Kiva loan and she is happy to have a line of credit to use to advance her business.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.  With the amount asked for, she will buy soft drinks of various brands and appearances.  She will buy by the box and via wholesale.

loans.use: Compra de bebidas gasificadas.

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is 53 years old. He lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with his wife and 20-year-old son. Murman has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Murman is an artisan and works on private orders to renovate houses. Additionally, he is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two pigs and sells piglets. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Murman has now requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Murman has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Murman will purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop. As the shop is opened, his wife will work as a saleslady and they both will do their best to increase the income of their family. Part of the income will be reinvested in the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries. 

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Glenda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

Glenda has been farming vegetables for six years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Jali

texts.en:
Jali lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, the youngest being two years old. Her activities for the last three years have been buying fish, frying and then selling the fried fish to her customers. She also has a small retail shop that she operates for extra income. 

Jali knew Milango through friends, and since she wanted to be financed she joined the group of women in participating with Milango. She now seeks a loan to buy 10 kilograms of fish to add to her stock. The 47-year-old mother has ambitions of owning a wholesale shop in five years time. The major challenge that she faces is bad debts. Some of her customers are from the neighborhood and sometimes may not pay back in time for her business to improve. Jani wants to educate her children to the highest level they can go and also to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: a loan to buy 10 kilograms of fish

loans.name: Raouche Group

texts.en:
Raouche is a group composed of five Filipino ladies working as housekeepers for Lebanese families. Raquel is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 40-year-old divorced mother of one child, standing on the left in the picture. Her child lives with Raquel's parents back in the Philippines, and she is the only financial provider of her family. Her low income can barely suffice for one person, which is why she decided to join the group and acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. It would help her settle the schooling tuition fees of her child.

As for the other group members, Imelda is standing in the center in the picture, Erlinda on the far right in the picture, Jennylyn second on the right in the picture, and Martina second to the left in the picture.

loans.use: to settle the schooling tuition fees of her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevsuren, 41 years old, lives with her 75-year-old mother, husband, two-year-old child, and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her mother has retired from work and gets a pension from the state. Her sister has been working as a manager at a photo studio for eight months. Her husband does building work on his own for a living. She herself has been working at the train station for twenty years and is considered to be the best worker by her colleagues. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, metals, fiberglass, foam, and a low pressure heater. Using those materials, her husband can make repairs and insulate their house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for the whole family. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus releasing less pollutants into the air, which contributes to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is from the village of Calaccab, Angadanan. He is 42 years old and married. To support his family, Alexander is busy managing their hog raising business. He has been in this business for five years. Right now, Alexander is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy hog feed and vaccine to sustain the proper growth of his livestock business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccine to sustain the proper growth of his livestock business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando, 43 years of age, is married, and they blessed with three children. He has managed a corn farming business for almost 17 years. Last cropping, his net income was 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). He wanted to seek a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can able to utilize it in his agricultural businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jose Mathias

texts.es: El Sr. José es casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio en un cafetín, ambos procrearon tres hijos que dependen de ellos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  El trabaja como conductor de vehículo pesado para la municipalidad de Juigalpa. Solicita este crédito para hacerle mejoras en su hogar, cambiar el techo en el área de los dormitorios ya que actualmente está en mal estado. Con este logro su familia contara con un hogar más cómodo, con mejores condiciones y sobre todo seguridad.
texts.en: José is married and his wife runs a coffee shop.  They have three children in their care who attend school.  He works as a heavy vehicle driver for the municipality of Juigalpa and is requesting a loan to renovate his home.
