She intends to turn a profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70) per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a hard-working wife to her husband and a responsible mother to her four children. One of her children has settled for marriage, another one is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), one is a farmer, and the youngest child is still studying. Marcelina is engaged in the tailoring business for three years.

Marcelina would like to request a loan of Php 5,000. This amount of loan will be used to buy stocks of garments and threads for her tailoring business. She knows that through this loan amount she could further increase her income and let her youngest child finish her studies. She hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can develop the pillow cases and curtains she sews and make her tailoring business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of garments and threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es la Alcancía Comunal  “Unión Por El Progreso” conformada por  08 personas responsables y carismáticas.  Con los deseos de surgir Rosa decide iniciar su negocio de  confección  y venta de prendas de vestir, es por ello que toma algunas clases de corte confección. Gracias a su esfuerzo Rosa puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de telas y así poder confeccionar mas prendas. Su mayor deseo es de producir en mayor cantidad, pues para ello necesita adquirir varias  máquinas de coser. Rosa de 44 años, es  casada con 01 aún dependiente. El grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” está agradecido con el crédito brindado. Rosa   se encuentra en la parte posterior,  viste casaca azul y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank "Union For Progress” [Unión Por El Progreso], comprised of 8 responsible and charismatic individuals. 

With a desire to succeed, Rosa decided to start a business sewing and selling clothes. To do so she took some sewing classes. Thanks to her effort, Rosa can continue supporting her family. 

She will use her most recent loan to purchase fabrics to be able to make more clothing. Her dream is to produce in greater quantity, and to do this she needs to acquire several sewing machines. Rosa is 44 years old, is married and has one dependent child. 

The group “Union For Progress” [Unión Por El Progreso] is thankful for the loan they have been granted. 

Rosa can be found at the back of the photo, dressed in a blue coat and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela tiene 56 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Manuela se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas bajas que son del gusto de sus clientes. Atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente desde su casa. Inició esta labor hace 18 años, empezó comprando en pocas cantidades con su propio capital y desde ahí continuo ampliar su negocio. Sus hijos la ayudan en la atención de los clientes. Le gusta tener el poder económico para ayudar con gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de aumentar la cantidad de sus productos y ver crecer su negocio incrementando sus ganancias económicas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar su negocio, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará cervezas y gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas para que siga trabajando.
texts.en: Manuela is 56 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children. Manuela sells soda pop and beer, so she has a refrigerator where she keeps her products at cool temperatures to the liking of her customers. She serves her customers in a friendly way right from her house. She began this work 18 years ago, buying in small quantities with her own money and from there continued expanding her business. Her children help her take care of the customers. She likes having the ability to help economically with the household expenses. She plans to increase the quantity of her products and watch her business grow along with her income. She seeks a S/. 2000 loan, she is very excited to know that there are people who will provide her economic support in order to continue her business, so she promises to be a punctual and responsible member. With the amount sought she will buy beer and soda pop of various flavors and brands in order to keep working.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beer and soda pop for her store.

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Dennis used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He is a thirty-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house house for residence. 

He has been selling clothes for the last six years and he has now ventured into timber sales to diversify his income sources. The business is profitable despite the hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and owning a boutique in the city.

He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Dennis is requesting a loan to buy timber and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Djiguissèmè  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Djiguissèmè 1 de Tema sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Tema dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Ramata (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac  d’engrais, un litre d’herbicide et 50kg de grains d’arachide. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 2,25ha, elle espère récolter 20 sacs d’arachide, 30 sacs de gombo, 1 sac de niébé et des fanes; En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production d’arachide, du gombo et du niébé sera vendue pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de premières nécessités et le reste serait auto consommé en famille. Madame Ramata a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the Djiguissèmè 1 group of Tema are married within large traditional families.  On average, they are 42 years old with four children each. They all live in the village of Tema, in the Koulikoro region (second-largest administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through family, marriage or neighborhood ties. 

In order to have agricultural inputs at their disposal at the start of the rainy season, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their third farming loan.  The members of the group will grow groundnut, okra and black-eyed peas.

Ramata, standing at the far right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy one bag of fertilizers, one liter of herbicide and 50 kilos of groundnut seeds.  She buys her agricultural inputs at the Bancoumana market.

With 2.25 hectares (5.55 acres) of cultivated land, she is hoping to get 20 bags of groundnuts, 30 bags of okra, one bag of black-eyed peas and their tops.  In addition to the black-eyed peas tops, part of the production of groundnut, okra and black-eyed peas will be sold to buy staple goods for her household.  The rest of the production will be consumed within the family.

Ramata's goal is to reach food self-sufficiency within her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea), herbicides and groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Juakine

texts.en:
Juakine is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For 5 years he has been practicing agriculture and also running a drug shop so as to boost his income. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a pharmacy. 

Juakine is requesting a loan to pay the workers who are weeding his garden and buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who are weeding his garden and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is aged 48 years old and he is married with seven children, of which three are school-going. Tom is employed as a sub county internal security officer for Bwikara, in the outskirts of Kagadi. It is from this employment that he gets money to support the family. He received a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to install power in his house for the previous cycle.

Tom has now applied for another loan of ugx.1,500,000 to buy sand and cement to plaster his residential house so that the family can stay in a decent environment.

Tom plans to buy land and start farming for commercial purposes to prepare for the period when he retires from formal employment, and also to support the family because at times the salary is not enough to support his plans and budgets.

loans.use: to buy building materials to plaster his house.

loans.name: Edgar José

texts.es: Edgar de 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 4 años, pues hace ,5 inició su experiencia en este tipo de actividad, porque varios de sus hermanos son pescadores y de su familia aprendió a conocer la calidad del pescado. En su oferta vende lebranche, bocachico, mojarra, a su principal mercado, conformado por tenderos y restaurantes, ubicados en el barrio donde habita. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza de  contado a sus hermanos, que le ofrecen una excelente calidad en los productos y él se afana en lograr muchos mas clientes con el servicio que ofrece, para ver crecer su negocio tal como es su propósito.  Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un congelador y pescado en mayor proporción,, Con esta inversión ampliará su oferta, porque logrará conservar el pescado con a calidad que amerita este negocio y esto es justamente su razón de éxito.
texts.en:
Edgar is 41 years old and has been making a living selling fish for four years. Five years ago he began his experience with this type of economic activity because several of his brothers are fishermen and from his family he learned more about the quality of fish. He sells fish including lebranche, bocachico and mojarra at the main market composed of shops and restaurants in his neighborhood. His sales are made in cash up front and on credit Mondays-Fridays from 8am until 11pm. He purchases his fish from his brothers in cash. They offer him an excellent quality of products and he works hard to reach many customers with the services he offers in order to see his business grow. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through this credit he will buy a freezer and fish in large quantities. With this investment he will expand his offerings because he will be able to conserve the fish with the care that this business requires, which is rightfully so, his reason to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and fish.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is an Iraqi youth client who is 24 years old and lives with his 2 brothers and his parents. Assad, his brothers and his father take part in providing the family income.

Asaad is a barber. At the age of 13, Asaad started working at his neighbor's barber shop as an employee in order to gain experience and learn this career. After learning all the techniques and gaining all the needed experience, Asaad successfully established his own independent business in 2008 and now he has an employee. He has become well-known in the neighborhood thanks to the special care he shows for his customers.

Asaad is requesting a youth loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop and install signage. Asaad is aiming to grow and expand his business by opening a bigger barber shop in the future so that he may provide more services for his neighborhood.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and install signage.

loans.name: Fokognouma  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe Fokognouma 1 de Samako sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 55 ans et 6 enfants; Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à temps, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Sanaba (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs  d’engrais, 2L d’herbicide, 50kg de grains d’arachide et utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour effectuer les travaux de labour. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 3,00ha, elle espère récolter 40 sacs d’arachide et 10sacs de riz; Une partie de la production serait vendue pour contribuer à la prise en charge de certains besoins du foyer et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
The majority of the nine members of the Fokognouma 1 group of Samako are married within large traditional families. On average, they are 55 years old with six children each. They all live in the village of Samako, in the Koulikoro region (second-largest administrative region of Mali). They know one another through family, marriage or neighborhood ties.

In order to increase the surface area of their cultivated land  and to buy agricultural inputs on time, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their third farming loan. The members of the group will grow groundnut, rice, okra and black-eyed peas.

Sanaba, seated first from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy two bags of fertilizers, two liters of herbicide and 50 kilos of groundnut seeds.  She will also hire male laborers to plow her land.  She buys her agricultural inputs at the Bancoumana market.

With three hectares (7.41 acres) of cultivated land, she is hoping to produce 40 bags of groundnuts and 10 bags of rice.   Part of her production will be sold to take care of some of the family's needs, while the rest  will be consumed within the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea), herbicide, groundnut seeds, and to hire male laborers for plowing.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 38 years old with five children and currently lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer dealing in maize.  He has done this since 1999. A good father that he is, he has managed to educate his children with the little profits he has made. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning and to diversify his farming activities to include animal rearing. Moses is requesting a loan to pay workers who are weeding and buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding and buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
Martha  es miembro de la alcancía Prosperidad y Éxito 
Martha es casada tiene 43 años, sus 03 hijos están en la escuela. Martha siempre ha trabajado y desde muy joven se inclino por el trabajo independiente, fue así que decidió abrir un bazar donde vende ropa y lencería, diariamente trabaja aproximadamente de 6 a 7 horas, su negocio le permite aportar estabilidad a su hogar y poder pagar la universidad de una de sus hijas. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá invertir en la compra de ropa para su bazar, sobretodo ropa de invierno que sus clientas le solicitan, para más adelante su sueño es tener un local propio; así no tendría que pagar alquiler permitiéndole mejores ingresos. Martha quiere agradecer por su préstamo y el de su grupo comunal ya que gracias a  los inversionistas de KIVA ellos pueden salir adelante.
Martha es la primera de la izquierda viste blusa a cuadros roja y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Prosperidad y Éxito (Prosperity and Success) community group. 
Martha is married, 43 years old, her three children are in school. Martha has always worked and since a young age was inclined to work independently. And so it was that she decided to open a bazaar where she sells clothing and lingerie. She works daily approximately 6 to 7 hours. Her business enables her to provide stable support to her family and be able to pay the university education of one of her daughters. With the loan she will be able to invest in buying clothing for her bazaar, above all winter clothing as that what her customers are seeking. In the future her dream is to have her own locale so she would not have to pay rent thus increasing her income. Martha is thankful for her loan and that of her communal group as now thanks to the KIVA investors they can be successful. 
Martha is the first on the left, dressed in the blouse with the red blocks and black pants.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en: Merelyn, 26 years of age and married, has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost six years, earning a net income of Php 700 daily. She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase spices, condiments, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell. Merelyn is hoping that her  loan request will be granted so that she can easily improve and expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase spices, condiments, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Tsogbadrakh

texts.en:
Tsogbadrakh, 45 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in its own house on plot of land. He has been working as a welder at a mining company for thirteen years and is considered to be one of the best workers by his superiors. His wife had been running a clothes sales business but recently stopped this activity. 

He is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to purchase planks, metals, blocks and shingles in order to repair his house and outer gate. As a result, he and his family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly the family will begin to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into air and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase planks, metals, blocks and shingles.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza is 35 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works abroad as a driver. Her children  attend school in the Secondary and Elementary. Aside from engaging in selling dental supplies, she also manages her livestock business. With her determination to help her husband in paying for their expenditures, she wanted to expand her businesses, especially her selling of dental supplies where she has already gained many customers from nearby towns.  

She wishes for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy brackets, anesthesia, wires, gloves and rubbers in bulk. She hopes to obtain the loan and be able to minimize her fare expenses in traveling to buy the products in Manila.

loans.use: to buy brackets, anesthesia, wires, gloves and rubbers.

loans.name: Nohemi Patricia

texts.es: Nohemí de 36 años de edad, habita en el suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en las edades de 11 y 7 años. Desde muy joven  Nohemí vio como su madre, una mujer comerciante,  se dedicaba a su trabajo y de  ello vivía. Ella adquirió toda esa experiencia  de su personal ambiente y en su edad adulta optó por aplicar todos sus conocimientos a la generación de ingresos, mediante el comercio de ropa blusas para damas, para caballeros y para niños. Así mismo en su oferta de productos de hoy,  están los artículos de cocina y los electrodomésticos menores que vende a una clientela ubicada en el sector donde habita y también se dedica  a ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento personal, para lograr que la gente siempre esté bella, con los servicios de peinados, blowers, manicure y pedicure, esta es una actividad complementaria, que le proporciona ingresos permanentes. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local comercial y adquirir su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, utensilios de cocina y productos de belleza. Nohemí es una mujer muy trabajadora  y muy seguramente todas sus metas logrará alcanzarlas.
texts.en:
Nohemí, 36 years old, lives in the southwest area of the city with her spouse and two daughters ages 11 and 7. Since she was very young, Nohemí saw how her mother, a vendor, worked and lived off her job. She gained experience from her personal surroundings and as an adult and chose to apply all her knowledge into generating income. She does so by selling clothes such as shirts for men, women, and children. She also currently offers cooking utensils and electronic appliances. She sells these to her customers in the area where she lives and also offers services such as personal improvement to help people look beautiful. She offers services such as hairstyling, blow-drying, manicures, and pedicures. This is a supplemental activity that provides her with permanent income.

Her goal for the future is to have a sales property and to buy her own home. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is her first time financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will buy clothes, shoes, cooking utensils, and beauty products. Nohemí is a hard-working woman and she will most definitely meet all her goals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cooking utensils, and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchenwares to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 57 year-old married woman from Nablus city.  She is a mother of four sons, all of whom are over 18 years old and work in several jobs and help their mother.  Fadwa does not work because she is old and not in very good health. 

Fadwa took a loan before from FATEN and she was very committed to paying premiums without any delays. Fadwa requested another loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of health care. This will help Fadwa with part of the urgent expenses she has. 

Fadwa appears in the photo while she was in FATEN office.

loans.use: to pay the costs of health care

loans.name: Fokognouma  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe Fokognouma 2 de Samako sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants; Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage; Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil,  le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Djenefing (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs  d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréales et 2litres d’herbicide.  Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 5,00ha, elle espère récolter 40 sacs d’arachide et 5sacs de mil, 5sacs de  riz, une trentaine de baignoire de gombo, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. Une partie de la production serait vendue en plus des fanes de niébé  pour assurer les besoins du foyer au quotidien et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Fokognouma 2 of Samako are married women living mainly in traditional extended families. On the average, they are 44 years of age, with four children. They all live in the village of Samako in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali) and know each other as neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage. With the goal of increasing their arable land, they have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third agricultural loan. The group members will grow peanuts, millet, rice, gumbo [okra] and “niebe” [ a type of black beans]. 

Mrs. Djenefing (the one standing on the far left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy three bags of urea, two bags of complex cereal fertilizers and two liters [0.5 gal] of herbicide. She buys agricultural inputs at the Bancoumana market. With a land plot of 5 ha [about 12 acres] she hopes to harvest 40 bags of peanuts, five bags of millet, five bags of rice, about 30 tubs of gumbo, and two bags of niébé beans and residues. Part of the produce, along with niébé residues, will be sold to provide for household needs, and the rest will be consumed by her own family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel se dedica a la elaboración de cuadernos y vive  en alquiler en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja  ocho horas al día.
Ariel  requiere el crédito para  la compra de materia prima, comprara papel, pegamento y asi mejoara sus ingresos.
El sueño de Ariel es ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Ariel makes a living producing notebooks. He lives in a rented home, with thin walls and wooden floors in the Obrajes area of La Paz.  He works eight hours every day.

Ariel needs a loan to buy basic materials.  He will buy paper and glue to improve his income.

Ariel's dream is to expand his workshop.

loans.use: to buy paper and glue to produce notebooks.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a jolly and friendly woman who loves cooking different Filipino foods. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer, and a member of their Barangay council. Evangeline and her husband work together to provide for their children's education. 
 
Evangeline manages their welding machine business in their village, offering services like machine repairing. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy a transmission and other materials needed in the operation of the business. 

She hopes to provide better services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a transmission and other materials needed in the operation of her business.

loans.name: Salvius

texts.en: Salvius is a 41 year-old married man who has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming, alongside teaching to boost his income. Hard working as he is, he has managed to start a retail shop and to educate his children. He has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and serving his clients better.  He is facing challenges of increased competition.  His desire is to expand his piggery project.  Salvius will use the loan to construct a bigger pig sty and buy more pigs.

loans.use: to construct a bigger pig sty and buy more pigs.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan es comerciante y vive en la casa e sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja  mas de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento que tiene.
Adan requiere el credito para el aumento de su mercaderia, comprara repuestos de celulares, celulares y otros.
El sueño de Adan es tener casa propia.
texts.en: Adan is a merchant. He lives in his parent's brick house, which has a concrete floor, in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood in the city of La Paz. He works more than eight hours a day, and this is his only means of support. Adan needs a loan to buy merchandise such as cell phones and parts. He dreams of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and parts for his business.

loans.name: Eric Lee

texts.en: Eric is a 26 year old hardworking man living in Kamwenge,Uganda. He runs a wholesale shop and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his siblings. He has hopes of owning a piece of land in the future and expanding his business to different areas, although he faces a challenge of price fluctuation. Eric is requesting a loan to buy more stock, like bags of millet, sugar, and boxes of soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like bags of millet, sugar, and boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Pheakdey's Group

texts.en:
Pheakdey, 29, is married and has two dependent children who are still small. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof, located in Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district.  The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice, while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to supplement the income. She has been running her business for five years, earning about KHR13,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR7,000 each day. 
Pheakdey received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. With a good business, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets to raise to earn additional income. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living and also send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch is aged 32 and married. She has three children. Living in a village of the Prey Chhor district, Sreytouch farms rice and grows cassava and supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the pig business for eighteen years, she manages to earn about 33,000KHR per day to feed her family and children. 
Sreytouch has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ulziibat

texts.en: Mr. Ulziibat, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a salesman for a private company. Using his automobile, he drives around the city meeting with clients and persuading them to sell his company's products. His wife specialized in building decoration and now works on her own. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase electric goods such as a vacuum cleaner, a television and a fridge. By doing so, he and his family can live in a comfortable place, which will give more enthusiasm to him. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase electric goods

loans.name: Pedro Renato

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro, es asalariado, su esposa vende tortillas de esta manera ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, tienen tres hijos que dependen económicamente de ellos, el cual los dos menores están estudiando. Pedro trabaja para la Alcaldía como conductor desde hace muchos años. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra. Para hacer un porche, de esta manera evitar que se meta hasta la sala el agua cuando llueve, provocando incomodidad a la familia.
texts.en: Pedro is a salaried employee, and his wife sells tortillas. They pay household expenses with their income. They have three dependent children; the two youngest are students. Pedro has worked as a driver for the mayor's office for many years. He will use the loan he has applied for to buy construction materials and to pay workers to build a porch that will keep rainwater out of the living room and avoid inconvenience for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33 years old. She is married with three children. She has sold food for the past 8 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans, corn and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo in front his house. 
Kholod is a 32 year-old married woman from a refugee camp in Nablus city. She is a mother with three children, two sons and one daughter.  Kholod's husband works as an employee in the United Nations organization in his city. He gets a good income but not enough to cover all the family needs. 
Kholod and her family live in a simple home.  It is a small, so Kholod and her husband would like to build an additional room. This will improve the living conditions for the family. 
Kholod took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Kholod and her husband to build an additional room on the family house.

loans.use: to build an additional room in the family home

loans.name: Pheak

texts.en:
Pheak is a 24-year-old single man who lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To make a living, he has been farming rice for almost three years and supplements his family’s income by working as a paid worker in garment factory. The current business earns him about 40,00KHR per day. 
He is in his first VisionFund cycle.  He is applying for a loan of 1,600,000KHR to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes that this loan will enable him to earn more crop yield from his business so as to fulfill his dream of having a decent motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 40, is from a rural village located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with four children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for twenty years. The current business earns her family about 32,000 KHR per day.

This is Heang first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old. She sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past nine years. With the loan, she would like to add new items, such as more Bitenge for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family. Bitenge are the fashion of clothes, most especially for women.

loans.use: To add new items, such as Bitenge.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina, 48 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer planting rice in their field. Ludivina has shared that her child is already married, but she still need to work for future emergencies. 

Ludivina is engaged in retailing; she sells various grocery items and vegetables. She also sometimes cooks dishes and sells them in their village. 
 
She travels three times a week just to buy goods in the market to sell. She earns her daily sales by buying something and selling it the next day. 

Ludivina is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy a stock of groceries and vegetables. She hopes to get a higher income in retailing to sustain their farming.

loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and son in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district of Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, farming 4 hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for ten years. She also works as a paid worker to earn more income for her family. The current business earns her family about 25,000KHR per day.  This income is used to feed the family, but she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Ra with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets, chickens, and ducks to raise in order to earn extra income for the family. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chicken and ducks to raise

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Iman is a 25 year-old married woman from a small village called Awartah near Nablus city. She lives in a small house with her husband and two sons. Her husband works as a paint agent. He gets a good income but it is not stable because it is seasonal work.
 
Iman and her husband would like to improve the home conditions by doing some decorations and by expanding it. They have requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help them to pay the costs of expanding the home and improving it. Iman and her family will enjoy living in their home in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs of expanding and improving her family home

loans.name: El Banquito Del Ahorro Group

texts.es:
Teodora es miembro de la alcancía El Banquito del Ahorro 
Esta alcancía está iniciando su cuarto ciclo, es integrada por 06 socios. Teodora es una de ellas, quien está casada y tiene 03 hijos; uno de sus hijos estudia en la universidad. Teodora empezó su propio negocio con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares  sobretodo ayudar a su hija en los gastos universitarios. Hace 02 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes donde vende toda clase de productos comestibles, en su negocio trabaja aproximadamente de 6 a 8 horas diarias, su tienda es muy frecuentada por sus vecinos y clientes en general, ha solicitado este crédito para comprar mercadería y así mantener su tienda surtida, está contenta con su grupo y más adelante le gustaría ampliar su negocio para convertirlo en minimarket.
Teodora quiere decir: ¡Gracias por el apoyo!
*En la foto es la primera de la izquierda,viste casaca color beige.
texts.en:
Teodora belongs to the communal bank El Banquito del Ahorro, which is starting its fourth loan cycle and has six members. Teodora, one of the members, is married and has three children, one of whom is in college. Teodora began her business to help her husband pay household expenses and, most of all, to pay for her daughter's college education. She has run her grocery store, where she sells all kinds of food products, for two years. She works there about six to eight hours every day. Neighbors and other customers shop there often.

She has applied for a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. She is pleased with her group and hopes to grow and convert her business into a mini-mart. Teodora says, "Thanks for the support!" She is the first on the left in the photo and is wearing a beige sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 29 years old. She sells clothes at her stall and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to add more Bitenge for sale at the stall. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, commonly known as Bitenge, for sale.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena has a tailoring business in Kangundo town. She makes dresses, skirts, suits and blouses. She has been in this business for 2 years and it has been profitable.

This being her third loan term, she plans to buy more stock of textile materials for making dresses and suits. Since she has many orders from her customers, she anticipates making more income with which she will use to educate her children by paying their school fees.

She hopes to open more tailoring shops and become successful in her business as well as be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more textile materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Rega

texts.en:
Rega lives in Serang, about 2 hours from Jakarta. Rega manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Rega is married and living with his child and wife in the family home.

Rega joined Ruma 4 years ago because he is interested in selling mobile phone airtime and wants to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma's staff, Rega sees improvements in his shop. For the last 3 months, he earned an average of $90-95 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand into more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 41 years old. She is married with four children and they all enrolled in schools. With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items for sale. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more retail items for sale.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti lives in Serang, about 2 hours from Jakarta. Siti manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credits. Siti is married and living with her child and husband in the family home.

Siti joined Ruma 1 year ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime and wanted to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma's staff, Siti sees improvements in her shop. For the last 3 months, she earned an average of $83-85 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand into more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Efigenia tiene 63 años, vive acompañada hace 33 años con el señor Claudelino de  58 años, la pareja tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales dos vive en el extranjero trabajando y los otros tres ya formaron su propio su hogar viven en forma independiente.
La señora Efigenia está trabajando como confeccionista de ropas hace 48 años , es decir, a los quince años termino su estudio y desde esa fecha siempre se dedicó a esta actividad y con eso ayudaba a cubrir los gastos de la familia, siempre respaldada por su marido que es carpintero. Durante todo este tiempo llegó a formar muchos clientes a quienes le confecciona sus ropas.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, cierre, para realizar confecciones para la temporada como  camisas, manteles, buzos y otros artículos. De esta forma tendrá la posibilidad de tener otros ingresos adicionales y con eso beneficiarse sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Efigenia is 63 years old. She has been with Sr. Claudelino, age 58, for 33 years. They have five children, two of whom are living and working abroad. The other three have their own homes and live independently.

Sra. Efigenia has been working as a seamstress for 48 years. She finished her studies at the age of 15. From that point, she has always devoted her time to sewing, which has helped to cover the family expenses. She has always worked alongside her husband, who is a carpenter. Throughout this entire time, she has gained many customers for whom she makes clothes.

Efigenia is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, and zippers for sewing. She will also buy seasonal items such as shirts, tablecloths, sweatshirts, and other products so that she can have another means of generating additional income. This will also benefit her customers.

loans.use: buy fabrics, thread, and zippers for sewing and seasonal products that she can sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and a shopkeeper. She is married to Mwaniki, a business man. They are blessed to have five children. Rose has been running her grocery shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of kES 4,000, which she uses to provide for her family.

Rose is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and cereals, to sell at her shop. With the expected profit from the business, she will expand her shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a plot of land, and to give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and cereals, to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 53 years old, married to Grace. He has a business of selling bananas at wholesale which he has operated for the past 27 years.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more  bananas. He paid his previous loan on time and hopes this anticipated profit will enable him build rental houses in his plot.

This is Michael's dream for the near future.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline, age 26, sells potatoes to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school.

With her loan funds, Joseline will add to her stock of potatoes. 

She will use the expected profits from the business to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Norma del Carmen de  64 años, casada, del municipio de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Ella se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por falta de recursos económicos.

Norma del Carmen, tiene por actividad, una pulpería, es  un pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como sobre de café, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan, huevos, leche, queso, detergente, jabón, sobre de shampoo. Jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo s surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Norma del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Norma del Carmen, 64, is married and lives in the city of Malpaisillo, located in the northern part of the country. She is responsible, hardworking, and eager to succeed. Sadly, for financial reasons, she could not pursue a degree and had to begin working at an early age.

Norma del Carmen has a small shop, where she sells items such as coffee, rice, sugar, beans, bread, eggs, milk, cheese, detergent, soap, shampoo, juice, sodas, and matches. She enthusiastically works and offers merchandise in her business for 12 hours each day. 

The loan will provide capital to stock her business with basic items so that she can earn more income. Norma del Carmen thanks Kiva lenders for the support they offer low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua to have decent work.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as coffee, rice, sugar, beans, bread, eggs, milk, cheese, detergent, soap, shampoo, juice, sodas, and matches.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 45 years old and single, yet she has adopted a child. She is grateful because, through her hard work and determination, she is able to run her business well. Lucresia runs her stall, wherein she offers various kinds of vegetables and some condiments, such as vinegar, soy sauce and salt.

Lucresia would like to take a loan of PHP 25,000. She will use this amount to buy various kinds of vegetables and condiments to resell at her stall, including tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, bitter melon, fish sauce, salt and vinegar. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted, so she could improve her financial stability, educate her adopted child, and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and condiments to resell at her stall, including tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, bitter melon, fish sauce, salt and vinegar.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. Her primary income sources are tea, crops, and breeding chickens and rabbits. She has been engaged in this work for four years. She has two children.

When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, she replied, "Rearing chickens and rabbits." She says her biggest challenge is "Brooding." 

Mercy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "To grow in farming." When asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she answered, "Doing agri-business."

Her highest monthly expense is covering essential family expenses. When asked how the loan will benefit her family, Mercy replied, "Uplifting living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mercy owns poultry but reports that she does not own the following: "cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household "mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD" but does not have "solar power, sewing machine."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Bwagonga Tukore Group

texts.en:
Bonny, a member of Bwagonga group, who is a mother of five, divorced the father of her children for practicing polygamy, a decision she made after forecasting that the future of their family was at stake due to the little income they used to get. 

She decided to remain a single mother so that she can raise her children well and also concentrate on agriculture. She grows crops and has a piggery, hard work and being honest elevated her from being a mere subsistence farmer to a commercial agriculturist. She has now managed to start a retail shop, which helps her to meet her day to day cash needs. 

She however wants to increase the size of her yields by planting more maize and beans such that she can get a bumper harvest and adequately meet her household needs. Despite being a single mother Bonny is proud of being able to pay her children's school fees and has a plan of educating them up to higher institutions.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She has been selling potatoes for the last couple of years. With this loan, she wants to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence, age 26, has a stall where she sells a variety of shoes to earn an income. She has been operating her business for eight years. Her husband runs his own business and they both help provide for their family.

With the loan, Providence will buy sandals and flip-flops to offer for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: buy sandals and flip-flops to offer for sale

loans.name: Zulianita

texts.es: Zulianita tiene 32 años, está casada, y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Zulianita se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales y también hace jugos, para lo cual instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. Se inició en su negocio hace 2 años con un préstamo de MFP y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía los deseos de  generar sus propios ingresos económicos para no depender completamente de su esposo y apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar. Viendo los resultados de su trabajo, desea continuar y con las ganancias desea establecer una pollería cerca a su casa pues lo ve como una oportunidad de negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas como mandarinas, naranjas, plátanos para venderlos y con los mismos preparar sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Zulianita, 32, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. Zulianita makes her living selling regional fruits. She also makes juices, for which she put a table in front of her house, where she can look after her customers in a friendly and polite way. She began her business two years ago with a loan from MFP and has been managing it herself since. 

Before starting her business, she wanted to generate her own income so she would not have to rely solely on her husband's income, and so she could help him with household expenses. Now that she has seen the results of her work, she wants to continue. With her profits, she is also hoping to start selling chicken near her house, which she sees as a good business opportunity.

At this time, she is seeking a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. She is grateful to those who are lending her what she needs to keep growing her business. She knows that she will continue being a very punctual client and will complete her payments on time. With the requested sum, she will buy fruits, such as mandarins, oranges, and bananas in order to sell them and make them into drinks.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell and make into juices.

loans.name: Verellin

texts.es: Verellin tiene 34 años, está casada y vive en su casas propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Verellin se dedica a la confección, arreglo y venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, ella se encarga de diseñar sus propios modelos y ofrecerlos a la venta en su pequeño local. Su paciencia y su pasión por cada uno de los detalles hacen que su trabajo sea de calidad. Trabaja sola desde hace 3 años y ha visto que esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos económicos que le han permitido sobrellevar los gastos que se presentan en su familia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, y ahora es una excelente costura, espera más adelante establecer un taller de costura y ser reconocida en todo el País. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará hilos y telas para continuar con su trabajo de costura, también comprará prendas de vestir para venderlos en la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Verellin, 34, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She is a seamstress, who makes, alters, and sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. She sells her own designs in her small shop. Her patience and passion for detail make her work high quality. She has worked alone for three years and has seen that the business generates excellent income that lets her pay household expenses. She loves her work and is now an excellent seamstress. She hopes to set up a couture workshop and become renowned throughout the country. 

At this time, she has applied for a loan of S/. 1500 and is grateful to lenders who will support her loan so that she can grow her business. She will be a punctual client and make her payments on time. She will use the loan to buy thread and fabric for her tailoring business and to buy garments to sell during the summer season.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan, age 47, owns and operates a convenience shop in his village to earn an income. He and his wife have four children and he is the sole financial provider for the family. 

All four children are enrolled in private schools, which means that Hassan has to settle the schooling tuition fees and expenses on top of all the other family expenses. This is why he needs to maximize his profit and provide the best possible life for his children. 

To gain an additional source of income for this purpose, he decided to contact Al Majmoua, hoping to acquire a loan that will help him renovate a house that he owns. He will then be able to lease the apartments and gain a monthly revenue, which will be greatly beneficial for his family in the long term. 

In the future, Hassan wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to renovate a house that he owns

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en la casa de su madre junto sus dos hijos. Julia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar,  harina, entre otros. Su actividad la realiza en un local en el interior de su propia casa. Su hijo mayor la ayuda en sus ratos libres con la atención de los clientes que cada día se incrementan. Lleva 1 año en esta labor. Le gusta este negocio porque genera cómodamente los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos del día. Desea hacer crecer su negocio con una adecuada administración de sus ganancias económicas y por supuesto con mucho trabajo y paciencia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de los productos comestibles más solicitados como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, leche y pan.
texts.en: Julia is 43 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her mother's house with her two sons. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, and flour. Her shop is located at her house. Her older son helps her tend to the customers in his spare time. The number of customers grows by the day. Julia has had this store for one year now. She likes it as a business because it is an easy way to bring in the money she needs for household expenses. Julia wants to expand her business by properly managing her profits and by patiently dedicating a lot of work to this endeavour. She asks for 1,000 peruvian soles and is very grateful for this chance at financial support, which will enable her to keep on with her work. She promises to always be on time for her repayments. With the funds, she will buy more of the most sought-after items, which are rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, milk, and bread.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Hiramu

texts.en:
Hiramu is a 36-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Lucy, a shopkeeper. Hiramu has been practicing farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Hiramu is applying for his sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.

He will use the loan to buy dairy cattle. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will restock his wife's retail shop. His hopes are to be financially stable and be able to provide comfortably for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander, 43 years old, is married to a midwife and blessed with two children. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for almost 4 years. In this business he's earning a net income of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) daily. He wanted to take out a loan of 25,000 PHP to put up additional business and for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve his business and  their standard of living.

loans.use: To put up additional business and for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Tiberious

texts.en:
Tiberious hails from Rukiri Nyarukiika, a place known for agriculture and local brew. Having seen the opportunity of surplus agricultural produce he started trading in produce where he buys it cheaply during periods of higher production then sells it when it's scarce on the market. This has enabled him to supplement on his regular agricultural income and he can now continuously maintain his income flow regardless of whether the season is off or on. 

Tiberious has applied for a Loan from UGAFODE to add to his savings and pay for a plot of land near his residence. He hopes to begin construction of a residential house if he gets enough money. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: Gregoria es socia del grupo “Las Maravillas” la cual lo conforma 09 socios emprendedores que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Gregoria una socia responsable la cual  hace varios años se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad.  Negocio que surgió con la idea de mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a podido apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y construir parte de su vivienda. Su siguiente meta es de  terminar de construir su casa. Su último crédito lo destinará para capital de trabajo, pues comprará  arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos y bebidas. Gregoria tiene 49 años, es casada  con 01 hijo aún dependiente. Gregoria junto al grupo “Las Maravillas” están felices y agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Gregorira se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo celeste y chaleco rosado.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the “Las Maravillas” group.  The group is comprised of nine enterprising members who look to improve each day.  This is the case with Gregoria, a responsible member.  

She has been selling basic needs products for several years.  The business arose from the idea of improving her family’s quality of life.  With the fruit of her effort, she has been able to support her children’s education and build part of her house.  Her next goal is to finish building her house.

She will use her last loan for working capital to buy rice, milk, sugar, noodles, and drinks.

Gregoria, age 49, is married and has one child who is still dependent upon her.  

Gregoria and the “Las Maravillas” are happy and grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

Gregoria is the first person standing on the right.  She has on a sky blue shirt and a pink vest.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, noodles, and drinks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 40, owns and operates a food kiosk to earn an income. She opened her business six months ago and now earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 after boosting her stock with the funds from her second loan.

Rose and her husband Thomas have two children, ages 10 and 22.

She is requesting a third loan in the amount of KES 70,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase cooking oil and bales of flour to use in her food kiosk. The expected profit she earns will be reinvested back to her business. 

She dreams of being financially stable and improving the support she can offer her children.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and bales of flour to use in her food kiosk

loans.name: Ada Lila

texts.es: Ada Lila, es madre de dos hijos menores de 12 años, una estudia y el menor de 6 aun no, su esposo es mecánico con quien comparte gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos  electrodomésticos, cosméticos por catalogo, también hace comidas rápida para vender, de esta manera Ada intenta salir adelante junto a su familia. Solicita este crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción, ya que su propósito es ir comprando poco a poco para cuando tenga lo necesario empezar a construir su vivienda de concreto, que actualmente es de madera, esto le permitirá cumplir su mayor sueño, el contar con una propiedad solida para la familia.
texts.en:
Ada Lila is the mother of two children under 12. One is a student, but her six-year-old is not. She shares the household expenses with her husband, who is a mechanic. Ada sells household appliances and catalog cosmetics and also makes and sells fast food to try to get ahead, alongside her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy construction materials. Her goal is to slowly buy materials to start building a concrete house to replace her wood home. This would help her realize her great dream: to have a well-built house for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and stone.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 29 years old. She sells foodstuffs, and she has been in this business for the past nine years. With the loan, she wants to add more foodstuffs to resell, such as maize, beans and sorghum. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to resell, including grains and beans

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. She has three children and has been farming for 20 years. Her primary income sources are crops, and income from personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming, for her:  'Rearing livestock.'  Her biggest challenge is pests and diseases.  Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Paulina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied:  'Because of its quick processing of loans.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session:  'Micro-finance offers loans at low interest rates.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Paulina replied that it will help her to give her children the best education.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paulina owns one or more cows and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy goat

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 54 years of age, is married to a construction worker, and they have been blessed with three, school-aged children. She's in a vegetable vending business. She has been selling various vegetables in her village for almost 10 years. In this business she's been earning a net income of PHP 200, daily. 

She wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 15,000. She will use it to purchase vegetables to resell, such as tomatoes, cabbage, eggplant, and squash. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be able to maintain her business progress.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, two of them attending school. For three years, she has been selling various items, such as sandals and flip flops. The loan she has requested will be used to buy more sandals and flip-flops for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family and to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy sandals and flip-flops for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru:
Рачабали глава дехканского хозяйства и житель села Чорбог района А.Джоми. Ему 54 года. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Дехканское хозяйство, в котором работает Рачабали и одновременно которым руководит, имеет 10,12 га орошаемого земельного участка, на 8 га из которых выращивается хлопок, а на остальных участках земли выращиваются помидоры, огурцы, кукуруза, капуста, лук, люцерна. Рачабали очень ответсвенный человек и относится к своей работе с вниманием. Сейчас ему необходимо обработать землю, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом для закупа минерального удобрения, топлива, а также для оплаты тракториста, чтобы продвигать свою земледельческую работу. 
Данный кредит поможет ему повысить производительность труда и таким образом улучшить его финансовое положение. Рачабали верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Rajabali is the head of a Dehkan farm and lives in the Chorbor district of A. Jomi. He is 54 years old.  He is married and a father of four children. The Dehkan farm that Rajabali works in and manages has 10.12 hectares of irrigated land, 8 hectares of which grows cotton, and the remainder of which is used for growing tomatoes, cucumbers, corn, lettuce, onions and alfalfa.  Rajabali is a very responsible man and treats his job with great care. 

To yield a quality harvest, he now needs to cultivate the land. To do so, he applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel, as well as to pay the tractor driver, in order to advance his agricultural work.

The loan would help him improve productivity and thereby improve his financial well-being. Rajabali believes in your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel, as well as to pay the tractor driver in order to grow his business

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is aged 33. She is married with three children, and they all go to school. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more flour of different types for sale in her boutique. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more flour for sale.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo es originario de Piedras Negras, es una persona soltera, amable, responsable y muy social,  se asocio con el Sr. Luis Rafael en un negocio de carpintería que aperturaron los dos, ellos son amigos desde hace ya muchos años y decidieron abrirlo en casa de Luis Rafael ya que a los dos les agrada mucho la carpintería, vecinos de ellos comentan que hacen muy buenos trabajos.
El Sr. Pablo pide apoyo através de KIVA para comprar más materia prima para seguir realizando más muebles, pues por el momento solo realizan sobrepedidos, pero tienen la intención de realizar muebles extras para empezar abrir ventas ahí mismo en su carpintería, dicen que en un futuro tienen pensando aperturar una mueblería, están cosncientes de que quizá eso les lleve algo de tiempo pero quieren ir empezando poco a poco, se sienten como en familia y son personas muy agradables.
texts.en:
Pablo is a native of Piedras Negras. He is single, friendly, responsible and very social.  Luis Rafael is his partner in a carpentry business that they both opened. They have been friends for many years and decided to open the business in Luis Rafael's house since they both like carpentry very much. Their neighbours comment that they do very good work.

 Pablo is asking for support through KIVA to buy more raw materials to continue making more furniture because at the moment they only make custom furniture but they intend to make extra furniture to start selling right there in their carpentry workshop. They say that in the future they are thinking about opening a furniture store. They are aware that it may take them some time but they want to go slowly. They feel like family and are very nice people.

loans.use: to purchase material for his business.

loans.name: Etir

texts.en: Etir is 39 years old, married to Esther, and blessed with four children aged 18, 16, 9, and 8 years respectively. He owns a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods in a business he started six years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 41,700. He has requested a third loan of KES 80,000 to purchase bales of flour, a sack of sugar and rice, detergent, and soap. The profit he earns will aid him to expand this business. He hopes to see his business grow as he educates his children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, a sack of sugar and rice, detergent, and soap

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 25 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for six years. With the loan, she wants to add more retail items for resale, such as kids’ clothes. 

The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more various retail items for sale in her boutique.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling various items in her boutique for the past ten years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy more retail merchandises for her boutique.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay is a 59-year-old married man. He has 2 sons and 3 daughters. Oktay is a merchant in his own town and by the way, he is very popular as a merchant because he has been selling food products for 30 years already, and he knows his business by heart. He works every day from Monday to Sunday, and his profit is about 150 AZN a week.

His wife takes care of the children at home, but sometimes she also helps her husband sell products. Oktay must buy more products for his market  such as a bread, sugar, meal and eggs, etc. but he hasn't enough funds to do it. Now he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy more products to sell. He hopes that this loan will help him to realize his dream of running a successful business in the near future. This is his first loan. Oktay loves his business, and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 33 years old. She is married with three children whose ages are between 6 and 12. They all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell, and she hopes to make more savings from the profits.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Shukufe

texts.en:
Shukufe is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. She works raising cattle that she fattens up and then sells in livestock and cattle markets. She also raises them to produce milk that’s then used to make dairy products, like custard, butter, and cheese. 

Her husband also helps her in this business. Shukufe and her husband started a farm 15 years ago. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. Shukufe sells the meat in the central bazaar where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume a lot of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is about 170 AZN monthly. 

She is applying for new loan of 1,800 AZN in order to expand the business by buying new calves. She plans to raise these calves, fatten them and sell them for meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. This is Shukufe's sixth loan.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying new calves.

loans.name: Keki Security Group

texts.en:
Erneus, who is in his late 20s, is married. He has been a carpenter since 2004. He works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 pm. He is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Erneus' fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more wood and made more furniture. He is really happy with the loan, which has made him make better furniture. He even managed to sell most of his furniture and is able to take care of his family with the profit he got.  He is doing very fine. He also used the profit to buy a TV set, sofa set, a radio, and a mattress.  

He will use this loan to open a retail shop with items like rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, salt, Blue Band (margarine), and cooking oil. 

He dreams of buying land.

Erneus will share this loan with his loan group, "Keki Security", with ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a retail shop with items like rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, salt, Blue Band, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 33 years old. She sells potatoes and has been in the business for six years. She has requested the loan to buy more potatoes for resale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To add more potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is 52 years old, married, and the father of two children. His wife is a teacher. Ilqar is growing fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. He says that even though this business is very hard, he has been handling the business for 25 years together with his wife without any difficulty.
 
Ilqar grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more lands for cultivation. Ilqar is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruit a lot.

Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history; this is his 5th loan.

loans.use: to buy new new fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is a 42 year-old married father of four children. He owns a small business where he has worked as a carpenter for 13 years while he opened his own business in 2008. His wife is unemployed, indicating that he is the only financial provider of the family. His children are enrolled in a public school in order to provide them with an education that he did not have the opportunity to acquire, since his highest degree is intermediate. 

Zakaria contacted Al Majmoua in order to enhance his business and increase his revenue. In fact, he decided to acquire a loan in order to register his business and his pick up in the state's papers. As for the future, Zakaria wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to register his business and his pick up in the state's papers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
