Grace is 37 years old, married to Jacob and blessed with two children, 12 and 16 years old. She has a butchery which has been in operation for the past five years. Her business has grown steadily and has satisfied many customers. She now earns a monthly income of about KES 30,000 after expanding her stock with the first loan she took earlier this year. 

She wishes to boost her business and has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more meat to meet the high demand. The profit she earns will help her increase her business and cater to her family's needs. She hopes to lead a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sale.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 41-year-old married father of four children. He is a Palestinian refugee living and working in Lebanon. He is employed in a manufacturing business that produces concrete for construction. His wife is unemployed and all of his children have not yet completed their studies, which means that his low salary is the only financial resource of the family. 

Three of his children are enrolled in public schools, while his oldest son studies at a private technical school. Youssef can barely provide for the food expenses of the family, which means that any other additional expense is a burden. 

Thus, he decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to settle the tuition fees of his son, Ahmad, who was born in 1995 and is in his last academic year studying computer science, on top of maintaining the family car. As for the future, Youssef hopes to launch his own concrete business and become the owner of it.

loans.use: to settle the tuition fees of his son, Ahmad, who was born in 1995 and is in his last academic year studying computer science.

loans.name: Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 30s, is a widow woman with four children still attending school. She is able to run her family through having two retail activities. One is fish selling, which starts early at 3:00 a.m., by Sophia traveling a distance to collect fresh fish; thereafter taking them for frying. After having completed the fish activity, she comes back home for selling them up until 3:00 p.m. 

She also has a clothes business and sells door to door after the fish business time. She generally does her activities from 3:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be Sophia’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to sell more fish and started her door-to-door clothes business. With the profit received, she bought a TV and solar power, and paid school fees and household expenses. 

Sophia will use this loan to buy more fish to resell. Sophia dreams to one day be able to build a house for renting and to be in a good position for affording school expenses for her kids.  

She will share this loan with her loan group" Mloganzila", which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'milk from the animals'. Her biggest challenge is: 'daily feeds price hiking'. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Grace'.

Ann was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "The treasurer of my group encouraged me to join."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'modern ways of dairy farming'.

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Ann replied, "We'll have enough money for the family's upkeep and school fees for children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ann owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle, automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janjay G.

texts.en:
Janjay G. is 36 years old, unmarried, and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil, and cassava.  

She has had a table business for the past three years. She works nine hours at her business. She used to get her goods at her shop. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is she has small capital on hand. She completed a university degree. She has two children aged 5 and 3. They live at home and are in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy pepper, oil, milk, candy, biscuits, etc., for her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her fiancee. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she makes more money.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy pepper, oil, milk, candy, biscuits, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 48-year-old married father of two children. He works as a cobbler in his own shop, where he fixes shoes and sells others. His wife is unemployed, which means that he is the only financial provider of the family. One of his children is enrolled in a public school, while the other is enrolled in a private school, which means that he has schooling expense fees on top of all the other expenses. 

Imad contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a loan in order to purchase shoes that he would then be selling, as well as a new work kit. As for the future, Imad wishes to expand his business by opening up another shop where he would be selling shoes exclusively.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell and a new work kit.

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Solidaridad
Una de sus socias es Mirian de 51 años, ella tiene un hijo de 08 años; en la actualidad vive con sus hermanas quienes son muy unidas y se apoyan mutuamente .Mirian trabaja por su propia cuenta, hace 05 años su hermana la animo a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa, gracias a su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hijo a quien cuida ella sola, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 7 horas y sus mejores clientes son sus vecinas, amistades y familiares, los fines de semana también vende algunas comidas que prepara en su casa y vende, el dinero del préstamo que ha solicitado lo utilizara para adquirir más ropa para su negocio, en un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda propia ahora no lo puede hacer por la falta de recursos, pero confía que pronto lo lograra.
Mirian agradece el apoyo de EDAPROSPO y todas las personas desinteresadas que permiten que ella, junto a su grupo comunal puedan obtener este crédito.
*Mirian es la tercera de la izquierda viste polo color purpura.
texts.en:
This is the Solidaridad (Solidarity) group.

Mirian, 51, is one of the partners. She has an eight-year-old son. At the present time she is living with her sisters whom are very close and supportive of each other. Mirian works for herself. Five years ago, her sister encouraged her to start her own clothing business. Thanks to her job she can pay for the living expenses of her son, whom she takes care of alone. She works about 7 hours daily. Her best customers are her neighbours, friends and relatives. On the weekends she also sells food which she prepares in her house and sells. 

The money from the loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase more clothing for her business. In the near future she wants to have her own store, now she cannot do it because of the lack of resources, but she believes that soon she will have it.

Mirian thanks EDAPROSPO for their support and all the people who have allowed her and her communal group the opportunity to obtain this loan.

*Mirian is the third on the left, wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 28 years old. She sells clothes and she has been running her business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Bitenge fabrics (machine printed and wax-dyed fabric) for resale. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more Bitenge fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Magrate is a 28-year-old lady from Bugumbe West, located in Migori county, Kenya. She supports 6 people in her family and is married to Simon, a businessman. They have six children, ages 13, 10, 8, 4 and 2, the last born being nine months old.

Magrate has a general goods shop where she has been selling industrial products like industrial salt. She has been doing this kind of business for the last 5 years and gets a monthly income of about KES 19,000. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase industrial salt for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a better future for her family and to expand her current business.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Fasu

texts.en:
Please meet 41-year-old Fasu from Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

He completed six grades and is married. His wife sells foodstuffs. He has three children between the ages of 12 years and 1 week old. The two oldest ones are in school, and they all live at home. 

Fasu has an auto shop, which sells engine oil, brake shoes, tyres, etc. He has been in business for three years and works from Monday to Saturday, ten hours each day.  

With this loan, he will buy engine oil, brake shoes, tyres, etc. to resell. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is fewer goods. He transports his goods by taxi. He started his business with 350 USD from his savings. He is proud of his business because today he has more than 350 USD. His plan is to buy more stock for his business.  

He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy engine oil, brake shoes, tyres, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria es originaria de la cd. de Allende, Coah., pero tiene prácticamente toda su vida viviendo en la cd. de Piedras Negras, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de chatarra ya viven solos pués todos sus hijos ya tienen sus propias familias, como la Sra. Victoria es una mujer muy emprendedora, también se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder invertir más en el negocio de la venta de chatarra, pués por el momento es el negocio que le da más ingreso y así con eso ella surtir el negocio de la venta de ropa usada y seguir saliendo adelante junto a su esposo, pues dice que no quisieran en un futuro sus hijos batallaran economicamente con ellos cuando ya no puedan trabajar, es por eso que tiene la intención de surtir el negocio de la venta de chatarra.
texts.en:
Victoria’s from Ciudad de Allende, Coahuila but has lived almost her entire live in the city of Piedras Negras.  She and her husband work selling scrap merchandise.   They now live alone since all their children have families of their own.  Since Victoria is a very enterprising woman she also works selling used clothing.

She’s asking for support via Kiva to be able to invest more in her business selling scrap because at the moment it’s the business that produces the higher income and with it she’ll be able to stock her clothing sales business and continue moving forward alongside her husband because she says that they don’t want in future that their children should have to struggle economically with them when they are no longer able to work and this is why she wants to stock the scrap business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her scrap business.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif is 56 years old, married, and has two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. Now Arif lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His son goes to school and is 16 years old. His daughter goes to university and is 19 years old. Arif wants his son to become a sportsman. Arif started his business five years ago to grow and resell calves. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to repair his farm. He wants to use the money for the future of his child. In the future, Arif wants to have a big farm for sheep and calves. This will be more profitable for his business. This is Arif's third loan. Arif is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to repair his farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and is a tailor. She is married to David. They are blessed with eight children. Lucy has been practicing tailoring for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

Lucy is applying for her first loan term with KADET. Lucy will use the loan to buy more materials for dress-making and curtain-designing.

With the expected profit from the business she will buy a sewing machine.

Her hopes and dreams are to be the best and the preferred tailor in her region.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last seven months. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of rice and sugar along with packs of oil and beverages. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and sugar along with packs of oil and beverages.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 46-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past six years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Iqbal’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of five children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 52 years old, a shopkeeper, and married to Winifred. They are blessed with five children. 

Stephen has been running his retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Stephen is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stephen will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del grupo de crédito Damas Responsables, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace 7 años, tiempo en el que establecido una buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, ya que su meta en común es mejorar sus fuentes de ingresos y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de una belleza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.

La Señora Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 23, 25, 17, 10 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan economícamente, su tercera hija está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora Rosa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, lleva en este negocio desde hace 15 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también en su negocio vende comida rápida y cosméticos. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda y así continuar creciendo.

Su sueño es no tener deudas y llegar a tener su propio capital.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the "Damas Responsables" loan group for seven years, during which time she has become good friends with other group members.  Together their mutual goal is to improve their income and move forward with their families.  Rosa lives in the area surrounding Cuenca, a city with natural and architectural beauty.  It has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999 and the city's food pleases the palate of all who visit.

Rosa is 45 years old, married and has five children, aged 23, 24, 17, 10 and 4 years old.  The two eldest work and support the household financially.  Rosa's third daughter is in high school, while the youngest two are in one of the city's primary schools.  Rosa's husband is an employee with a private business.  The family lives in their own house.

Rosa has had a grocery shop for fifteen years, working seven days a week with no fixed timetable.  She also sells fast food and make-up.

Rosa will invest her loan in buying supplies for her shop and thus will continue to expand it.

Rosa's dream is to have no debts and to have her own capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Burzu

texts.en: Burzu is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. Now Burzu lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. Burzu is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Burzu started his business five years ago to grow and resell calves. Now he needs a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy more calves. He wants to use the money for the future of his child. In the future, Burzu wants to have a big farm for calves. This will be more profitable for his business. Burzu is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. It was his third loan on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Djiguissèmè  2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants, les sept  membres du groupe Djiguissèmè 2 de Tema vivent toutes dans le village de Tema dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le riz, l’arachide, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Kadidia (femme debout devant avec la daba sur la photo) est une grande productrice d’arachide dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac  d’engrais, 2l d’herbicide et 50kg de grains d’arachide. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 2,25ha, elle espère récolter 20 sacs d’arachide, 30sacs de gombo, 1 sac de niébé et des fanes; En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production d’arachide, du gombo et du niébé sera vendue pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de premières nécessités et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
The group Djiguissèmè 2 of Tema consists of seven women who are for the most part married in large traditional families. They are on average 38 years old with five children. They all live in the village of Tema, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali) and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. They joined the SORO YIRIWASO microfinance organization to ensure that they have inputs on hand at the start of the rainy season, and this is their 3rd loan cycle. The group members plan to grow rice, groundnuts, okra and cowpeas.

Mrs. Kadidia (standing in the front row and holding a hoe) is an important groundnut farmer in the village. She will use her loan to buy one bag of fertilizer, 2 liters of weed-killer, and 50 kg of groundnut seeds. She buys her supplies at the fair of  Bancoumana. 

She's hoping that her 2.25 hectares will yield 20 bags of groundnuts, 30 bags of okra, 1 bag of cow peas and some cowpea straw. This cowpea straw, as well as a portion of the groundnut, okra and cowpea crops, will be sold to help provide for some of the household’s basic needs while the remainder will be used by the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 28-year-old single Palestinian who has worked as a plumber since 2001. He is a hard worker with limited working access and domains just like most Palestinians living in Lebanon.

He was only 16 years old when he started working in order to help his parents in making their living and covering their expenses.

Hisham is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new updated tools for his business.

This loan will help him a lot in developing his business and improving his socioeconomic situation in a well-managed way, so that he might think of making a small beautiful family in the future.

loans.use: To buy new updated tools for his business

loans.name: Zarrinakhon

texts.en:
Zarrinakhon is 22 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She graduated from school with excellent marks and entered the Tajik State University of Business and Politics. She is a student of the 6th course in the faculty of Taxes. She is one of the best students of her university because she studies well and reads many books. 

She must pay for her tuition at the university but she does not have money and her parents can’t support her. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 37-year-old married woman who has eight children. She has been weaving sweaters for a period of about 10 years. She works hard on her weaver every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. Perveen is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna es una clienta con 28 años de edad, casada pero separada, madre de una niña. Actualmente vive en unión libre. Es trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Cuando se separó de su esposo su negocio decreció debido a que tuvo que asumir los gastos del hogar. Ahora cuenta con una pareja que le ayuda en las necesidades básicas de su familia y por eso ella quiere invertir nuevamente fuerte en su actividad. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio ambulante de ropa y de ventas por catálogos. Gracias a su experiencia y al buen trato que le da a sus clientes le va bien, debido a ésto ella solicita otro crédito a la Fundación para reforzar su negocio comprando mercadería y pagando un pasivo a un proveedor.
texts.en:
Johanna is a 28-year-old married but separated client; she’s the mother of a little girl.  She currently lives in a common law relationship.  She’s hardworking and has a business outlook.  

When she separated from her husband her business fell off because she had to take on household expenses.  Now that she has again has a partner who helps with the family’s basic needs she wants to once again invest heavily in her activity.  

She’s always worked selling clothes from place to place and selling by catalog.  Thanks to her experience and the good customer service she provides she does well.  Because of this she’s asking for another loan from the Fundación to strengthen her business purchasing merchandise and paying off a pending bill with a supplier.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes by catalog.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha, habita en un barrio marginal de Managua, es una señora madre de dos hijos con uno a su cargo, ella no tuvo suerte con su pareja, por lo que en la actualidad se encuentra luchando sola para salir adelante, continúa con su labor como recepcionista. Solicita el crédito para construir el muro frontal y poner verjas en su casa, esta mejora le permitirá garantizar la seguridad de la familia.
texts.en: Martha lives in a marginal neighborhood in Managua.  She’s the mother of two children one of which is still dependent on her.  She wasn’t lucky with her spouse so she’s now trying to make it in life alone.  She continues employed as a receptionist.  She’s requesting the loan to build a new front wall and to install metal grills at home; this improvement will make it possible for her to guarantee her family’s safety.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal rods and concrete blocks.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 22-year-old single man with one dependent. He sells leather jackets, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 70,000. He has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more jackets for sale. The profit he earns will aid him to expand this business and repay his loan. He hopes to see his business grow and have a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase more leather jackets to sell.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Doña Alba es una clienta de 73 años de edad, casada, no tiene hijos. Trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Siempre se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos, debido que a la hora de las ventas son buenas las ganancias. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en su negocio. En ocasiones cuenta con la ayuda de un familiar de su esposo para el cuido de los animales, cuando ella tiene que salir a hacer diligencias personales. Es una clienta con mucho entusiasmo y trayectoria en la Fundación. Obtuvo varios créditos en la modalidad de banco mujer y ahora se graduá al crédito individual. A pesar que el ciclo de producción de los cerdos es de entre cuatro y cinco meses, ella cuenta con una pensión, la cual va tomar parte de la misma para el pago mensual de la cuota. El préstamo lo va invertir en comprar varios cerdos, alimentos y más.
texts.en:
Alba’s a 73-year-old married client; she has no children.  She’s hardworking with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  She’s always worked raising pigs because at the moment of selling them profits are good. Her husband helps her with the business.  Occasionally a relative of her husband’s helps care for the animals when she has to go out on personal errands.

She is a very enthusiastic client with a track record in the Fundación.  She took out several loans under the women’s bank modality and now has graduated into a personal loan.  Even though the growth cycle for pigs varies between four to five months, she gets a pension and she’ll use part of it to make her monthly payments.  She will use the loan to buy several pigs, feed and others.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up.

loans.name: Gulbaz

texts.en: Gulbaz is a 48-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for 10 years. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They have five cows for milk and sell it to many of their neighbors. Gulbaz also makes butter and cheese with this milk and generates extra revenue. She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. In this they earn good amount of income to fulfill the needs of their children. Gulbaz has some past savings and requested for a loan of PKR 10,000 to purchase one baby cow. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. Her dream is to maximize their profit from this business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase one baby cow.

loans.name: Shabahana

texts.en:
Shabahana is a 30-years-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes and bags for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  She is successfully running her business with the support of her husband. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons to increase her revenue so she can generate more robust sources of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zoila Rodolfina

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Damas Responsables, le gusta mucho esta forma de créditos porque comparte con sus amigas y vecinas, y con los créditos puede continuar creciendo en su negocio. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de una belleza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.

La Señora Zoila tiene 50 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos trabaja y ayuda económicamente, tres de sus hijos están estudiando en la universidad y su ultimo hijo cursa los estudios en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y trabaja en una boutique.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una gran variedad de cosméticos para iniciar con este negocio. Se encuentra formando parte de este hermoso grupo hace 2 años. 

Su sueño es tener su propia boutique ya que le gusta la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Zoila is a kind, gracious client who is part of the “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Ladies) credit group.  She likes this way of borrowing very much because she shares with her friends and neighbors and the loans allow her to continue growing in her business.  She lives around the city of Cuenca, a city that enjoys natural and architectural beauty.  It’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since 1999 and its cuisine enchants whoever visits it.

Zoila is 50-years-old and divorced.  She has conceived five children four of which are adults; one of her sons works and helps her out economically, three of her children attend university and her youngest attends secondary school.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Zoila does her housework and also works in a boutique.  She will use her loan to buy a wide variety of cosmetics to start out in this business.  She has been a part of this beautiful group for two years.  Her dream is to have her own boutique because she likes to provide customer service.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Oscar Iván

texts.es: Oscar es un joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Hace 5 años se dedica a la actividad de fabricación de herradura de manera artesanal y cuenta con las herramientas básicas para hacerlo. La actividad la aprendió por medio de un amigo. Es un joven enérgico y trabajador, no se detiene por la falta de recursos, trabaja en la parte de atrás de su casa y, los productos que termina los vende a un mayorista. Con el crédito que solicita con la Corporación desea comprar materiales al por mayor (lámina de acero, hierro, carbón) con el fin de obtener un mejor precio y por ende tener más utilidades generadas por las ventas. Su mayor sueño es continuar con su oficio y hacer crecer su negocio para tener un mayor nivel de ingresos y ofrecer nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who is 20 years of age and has no children. For the past five years, he has been making handcrafted horseshoes since he has the basic tools for doing this type of work. He learned this trade from a friend.

Oscar is an energetic and hardworking young man. The lack of resources has not stopped him. He works in an area outside of his house and his finished products are sold to a wholesale vendor. The loan he is requesting from Interactuar will be used to buy materials in bulk (steel sheets, iron, and coal) so that he can obtain the best price. As a result, he will be able to generate more profit from his sales.

His greatest wish is to continue with his trade and grow his business so that he can reach a higher income level and provide new job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy steel sheets, iron, and coal in bulk.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa, se encuentra en el 21º ciclo, hace ya bastante tiempo vienen trabajando con la institución, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, este grupo con el tiempo ha ido fortaleciéndose cada vez mas, y cuentan con valores como la solidaridad y el compañerismo ya instalado entre ellas, desean seguir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo del programa de comités.
La Sra. Victorina es la presidenta del grupo, su actividad se basa en la venta de manualidades producidas con sus propias manos, a pesar de tener ya 45 años ella decidió seguir estudiando y este año termina la carrera de Farmaceutica, su sueño es habilitar su propia farmacia en su domicilio pues le apasiona ese rubro, vive con sus 3 hijos y su marido en casa propia.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de insumos de manualidades, como ser hilos, pinturas, tamborcitos y otros, tiene clientela formada y bastantes pedidos de sus trabajos se esmera en que sus clientes queden conformes y se gana la fidelidad de los mismos con cada entrega que realiza.
texts.en:
The group called “Santa Rosa” is in its 21st loan cycle since the members have worked with Fundación Paraguaya for quite some time. All of them have businesses in different trades. Over time this group has gotten stronger and all of the members have demonstrated values such as unity and camaraderie. They want to keep growing and always have the support of the committee program.

Sra. Victorina is the group president. Her business involves selling crafts that she produces with her own hands. Despite being 45 years old, Victorina decided to continue her studies and will earn her degree in Pharmacology this year. Her dream is to establish a pharmacy in her home since she is passionate about this line of work. She and her husband live in their own home with their three children.

Sra. Victorina is requesting a loan in order to buy craft supplies such as thread, paint, small drums, and other items. She has an established customer base and plenty of work orders. Victorina strives to keep her customers happy and gain their loyalty with each delivery that she makes.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies such as thread, paint, small drums, and other items.

loans.name: Erika Ismenia

texts.es:
Erika, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, necesita invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas, como el abono, herbicidas y foliares, que son necesarios para el inicio de la siembra, con esto considera que su cultivo tendrá lo necesario, para generar ingresos de la cosecha, estos le servirán para pagar sus estudios y comprar alimentación.
Considera que los préstamos han mejorado su situación económica, gracias a la inversión que dio al cultivo con el crédito Kiva.
texts.en:
Erika decided to request a new loan because she needs to invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, and foliar fertilizers. These items are needed for the start of the planting season. By providing what her crops need, Erika will be able to generate income from her harvest. The money she earns will be used to pay for her studies and to buy food.

She believes the loans have helped to improve her financial situation. Thanks to the investment of her Kiva loan, she will be able to produce a crop.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 26-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. They are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She completed 12th grade before starting her business.  She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County. Bong is located in the center of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Marie has a shop that sells blouses, tee-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc.  She works from 8 am to 5 pm every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge is a small amount of capital. She intends to use the loan to buy more blouses, tee-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc. for her business. She started her business with money from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes profit.  She hopes to one day own a car.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, tee-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 27 years old and enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She has two daughter and two sons. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family.

She started doing embroidery work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Due to increased in demand for her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business to work for her. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 30000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Manjela

texts.en:
Manjela is an Egyptian Albanian and is requesting a loan to pay off her university fees. 

She is a 24-year-old married mother of this 2-year-old adorable daughter who is in the photo with her. They reside in a city with a large number of ethnic Egyptian Albanian people. “I have been going to school to become a teacher, which has been my dream for a very long time. I can’t wait to finish my studies, write my exams and then hopefully find a job in my field. There are schools serving particularly our community where I can teach.  At the same time though, I have been selling used-clothes in order to make a little income. My husband, too, has been working as a waiter. We both are young and hard-workers, and we hope that someday we will see the benefit of working hard,” Manjela said.

“This is my first time applying for a loan, but knowing myself very well, I would ensure Kiva’s potential lenders that I will pay the loan on time,” she ended saying.

loans.use: To pay off her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 48-year-old married woman.  She is the loving mother of seven children; her husband is a laborer, and earns a nominal amount of income to support the needs of the family members. 

For the past three years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales in her town. She has two buffaloes to milk, and she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Arshad is happily helping her husband financially to run their household efficiently. For the improvement of her business, she applied a loan of Rs. 25,000 through Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. 

She expects a boost in her earnings from her loan, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Saxavat

texts.en:
Saxavat is 50 years old, married, and has three daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. 

Now Saxavat lives in the Fizuli region; his wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His daughters goes to the university and college. 

Saxavat started his business to raise and sell calves two years ago. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to to build a stall for the cows. He wants to use the money for the future of his daughters. 

In the future, Saxavat wants to get more calves for his new stall. He is very thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to build a stall for his cows.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 24-year-old married woman. She runs a small beauty parlor in a corner of her house and offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers; she makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Fozia needs to get more customers all the time. For this reason, she needs to purchase some furniture, such as couple of chairs, along with packs of makeup kits. That is why she applied a loan of Rs. 35,000 through Kashf Foundation.  

She is in her fourth loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business, and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase some furniture, such as couple of chairs, along with packs of makeup kits.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne and her husband had worked for large corporations for many years; however, they never forgot their parents’ accomplishments. Their parents had worked hard to open their own small businesses, and that inspired them. Anne and her husband dreamed of the day that they, too, would be able to own their business.

In 2008, they began to pursue that dream. It took a lot of hard work and a lot of searching, since financing was not easy to come by, especially in the economic downturn. However, Anne and her husband were able to receive a loan to purchase a store that was part of a franchise, The UPS Store. This store had been poorly managed for several years leading up to the sale, so upon taking over, they had their work cut out for them. Much of the equipment in the store was old and not functioning properly, and they realized that to make their business profitable, they would need to invest in new equipment or risk failing.

This Kiva loan will help them purchase the equipment they need to keep the store afloat and offer their services in the best manner possible.

loans.use: to purchase machinery and equipment needed to keep the store afloat and offer services in the best manner possible.

loans.name: Gladys Suzana

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys forma parte del grupo de crédito Damas Responsables, en todo este tiempo ha logrado crecer en su negocio. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de una belleza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.

Doña Gladys tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años, su primer hijo se dedica a trabajar y le ayuda economícamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería y tapicería, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. Gladys desde que se caso le ayudado a su esposo en su negocio el cual es la tapicería y carpintería, esto le a permitido pasar tiempo con sus hijos y sacar adelante el negocio familiar. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de madera y telas, está repitiendo el crédito  ya que necesita comprar madera, esponjas, hilos, etc. para seguir con el negocio.

Su meta es continuar agrandando su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is part of the Damas Responsables communal bank.  In all of this time she has managed to grow in her business.  She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city possesses natural and architectural beauty.  It has been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  Its cuisine captivates the palate of those who visit.

Gladys, age 41, is married and has two children, ages 18 and 16.  Her first son works and helps her financially.  Her second son is attending a city high school.  Her husband has an upholstery and carpentry shop. They live in their own home.

Ever since she got married, Gladys has helped her husband in his upholstery and carpentry business.  This has allowed her to spend time with her children and to get ahead with the family business.

She used her previous loan to buy wood and fabric.  She is repeating the loan because she needs to buy wood, sponges, and thread, etc. in order to continue with the business.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy wood, fabric, and thread, etc.

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es: Eliecer , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa  y cuatro hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Eliecer, age 66, is an enterprising man.  He is married, and he currently lives with his wife and four children.  He requested a loan because he wants to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.  He wants to give care to his coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition while they are developing.  He wants to do this in order to get a good quality product.

The only limit that this gentleman has is the lack of money in order to continue growing.  They depend upon this business activity in order to be able to get  ahead.  That is why he is requesting a loan.  It is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Aziz  Fatima

texts.en: Aziz Fatima is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son in the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene la edad de 52 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years-old, married and lives with her husband and two children. She wants the loan to purchase fertilizer and hire labor for a coffee plantation they want to start. She wants to provide proper maintenance to the crop so that it will produce more and she will have higher earnings.

She hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future. As well, she wants to be able to continue growing as a person and a producer. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had never applied for other loans previously from state banks, however FUDECOSUR made this loan to her with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran, age 54, has been selling milk from her three buffaloes with the support of her husband for about 12 years. She also makes butter and cheese with this milk to generate extra revenue. Her husband assists her by selling the milk door-to-door on a daily basis. They feel pleasure in conducting this business to secure the future of their two children, both of whom are attending school.

Sughran needs to earn much more to meet their everyday needs, which include food, clothing and education. She has therefore requested a loan of Rs 45,000/- to purchase another buffalo to increase milk production, hopeful of earning more revenue through a greater volume of sales.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Gloria Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza junto a sus amigas y vecinas del grupo de  crédito Zhullin. Vive por los alrededores de la vecina ciudad de Azogues, lugar de clima frió, esta ciudad tienen una característica especial ya que se encuentra asentada inclinada mente debido a su geografía, su gente es artesana muy hábiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gloria tiene 31 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 14,12, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio, sus tres hijos siguientes están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.

La Señora. Gloria se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidando de sus hijos, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cuyes, estos animalitos lo vende en su ciudad. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y  alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
This is Gloria's third loan that she has taken out along with her friends and neighbors from the Zhullin loan group. She lives in the outskirts of the nearby city of Azogues, a place with a cold climate. This city has a special characteristic of being located at a slant due to its geography. Its people are very competent artisans who maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples.
 
Gloria is 31, married and with her husband has had five children who are 14, 12, 10, 7 and 2 years old. Her first child is studying in college, the next three children are studying at a little school in the city. Her husband works as a builder. They don't have their own house so they rent. 

Gloria works doing the household chores and looking after her children, but in order to contribute to the household finances she works raising chickens and guinea pigs and sells these little animals in her city.

She is going to invest her new loan in buying chickens, guinea pigs and animal food. 

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal food.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy  tiene  23  años de edad, esta soltero y vive con los padres   actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra  ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Roy is 23 years old. He is single and currently lives with his parents. 

With the loan he hopes to buy supplies like fertilizers, and fumigants, and in turn help the labour force. He intends to maintain the fields no they don't suffer any damage and so they don't lose production, and so with his coffee-growing project be able to generate more profits to contribute to his family. 

He doesn't have the necessary capital to buy what he needs because he has a low income and doesn't have a way of getting the money he needs for this. So he is applying for a loan, and it's the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a more convenient loan with much lower interest rates....

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 28 years old and married to Geoffrey.  They have one child.

She runs a boutique in Kiambu and has been in this business for six years.  Lucy earns a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Lucy's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy stock like shoes and clothes. 

In future Lucy wants to open another boutique.

loans.use: to buy stock like shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Elionora Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Elianora se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Zhullin, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Azogues, lugar de clima frió, esta ciudad tienen una característica especial ya que se encuentra asentada inclinada mente debido a su geografía, su gente es artesana muy hábiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Elianora tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo está estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión sastre, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Elionora tiene su casa un bazar y papelería, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo desde hace 18 años, como su negocio está en su casa  puede dedicarse a sus hijos. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar y papelería para continuar creciendo en su negocio. 

Su meta es continuar ampliando su local.
texts.en:
This is Elianora's fourth loan that she has taken out along with her friends and companions from the Zhullin loan group. 

She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues, a place with a cold climate. This city has the special characteristic of being located at a slant due to its geography. Its people are very competent artisans who maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples.

Elianora is 40, married and with her husband has had two children who are 15 and 5 years old. Her first child studies in college, and her second child is studying at school. Her husband works as a tailor and they live in their own house.

Elianora has a dollar store and stationery shop at her home. She has worked from Monday to Saturday without a fixed timetable for 18 years. Because her business is in her home she can look after her children. 

She is going to invest her new loan in buying items for her dollar store and stationery shop to continue growing her business. Her goal is to continue to extend her premises.

loans.use: To buy items for a dollar store and stationery shop.

loans.name: Sarwary

texts.en:
Sarwary is 33 years old married woman and the mother of 3 children.  For 15 years, Sarwary has sold milk.  She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family.  

With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income.  This has all happened due to her courage and determination.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. 

Sarwary has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.  She feels proud to support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Flory

texts.es: Flory tiene la edad de 39 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Flory se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Flory is 39-years old, married and has two children.  She wants a loan to purchase cattle.  When they are grown, she will sell them to earn an income.  The cattle business will help her and her family to get ahead.  This is the first time that Flory is getting funded through FUDECOSUR.  She states that the loan group has helped her a lot and has offered her good terns.  She hopes to see her project grow and to meet her goals.  Then, in the future, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and better financial stability.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has never before taken a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en:
Hafizan is a 36 year old married lady who runs a small general store at the corner of her house.  She has been in business for many years.  

Hafizan sells a variety of grocery items at a reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Hafizan makes enough to provide for her family.  

To fully stock her store Hafizan requested a loan for Rs 30,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing customer demand more consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a quality education to her five children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, age 32, sells milk and has been in business for many years.  She is a mother of one child (see photo). 

She has one calve and two cows.  Asia sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. 

Asia is very motivated to provide her family with all the basic necessities of life.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses.  

To inflate her sales she needs to purchase one more cow.  Asia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000.  

She wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian , un hombre emprendedor , tiene  25 años de edad, está soltero y vive con la mama  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante el y la mama , por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Adrian is an enterprising man.  He is 25-years old, single and currently lives with his mother.  He is requesting a loan with the hopes of purchasing supplies like compost and insecticides.  He hopes to use them to help out his coffee crop.  He wants to keep the crop healthy as it grows so he can obtain a good quality product.  The only limit this gentleman faces is a lack of money, which would otherwise allow him to keep growing his business.  He and his mother financially depend on this business to get ahead, which is why Adrian is requesting a loan.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan at better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase compost.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Five years ago she started selling cloths from her house.  She purchases variety of cloths from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to retail customers.  Gulshan has retained many customers and earns enough to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availabile funds, Gulshan is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  That is why she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied her third loan of Rs. 35,000, to purchase more variety of cloths of summer season in different colors. 

Gulshan expects to boost her net income by increasing her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloths for the summer season, in different colors.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 33 year old married woman.  She has been successfully running an animal sales business with the support of her husband (see photo).  

Zubaida has one calve and two cows.  She looks after the animals while her husband sells them on seasonal basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.  They have two daughters and one son; two of them attend school. 

They need to earn much more money to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education expenses. 

In order to make huge profits, Zubaida requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy one more cow.  She expects boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old and blessed with one child.

She runs a boutique and she has been in business for 10 years.  Her monthly income is KES 8000.

Beatrice is borrowing KES 20000 to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Musaya

texts.en:
Musaya is a 57 year old shopkeeper; she is a widow and mother of six.  Musaya has been running her retail shop for the past 30 years.  Her monthly income is ksh 3000.  She uses the money to support her family. 

Musaya is applying for her fourth loan with KADET.  She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, cooking fat etc.

With the anticipated profit from the business, Musaya will expand her business.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Nure

texts.en:
Nure is a 53 year-old widowed mother of two and an ethnic Egyptian Albanian, living in a city in the central Albania. 

After the collapse of the previous regime, in 1990, the government granted her some land where they could build a home.  Before that, many people lived in shacks.  While some members of her community thrived, some are still struggling even today, and Nure is one of them.

Nure sells used clothes and also collects and sells scrap for cash.  

With a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek she wants to pay for scrap.  This is Nure's second loan. 

Nure remains optimistic that lenders will help her financially.

loans.use: to pay for scrap.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 37 year old married woman. She has sold fruit for many years.  Parveen is very enthusiastic and manages to earn reasonable amount of money to support her family.  She is a loving mother of four children and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities. 

To improvement for her business Parveen contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and peaches. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.  Parveen is hopeful to increase in her income by generating greater sales.  Parveen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and peaches.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is 30 years old, married and father of four children.  He is a well-known fruit seller in his town.  Vaqif has dedicated 30 years of his life to this activity.

Vaqif says, "I love my business because it is my only source of income.”  

Vaqif has a need to expand his business by buying fruit trees, to get more land for cultivation and to get his daughters married.  His first goal is growing his fruit business so he can take care of financial needs of his family.

Now it is summer time and Vaqif needs more varieties of fruit to sell because of increasing demand.  

He needs a 2000 AZN loan to increase his stock of fruit.  Vaqif has a good loan history and this is his fourth loan.  He hoped for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fruit.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 35, is married and has children. She has a boutique business in Kangundo town, where she sells clothes, bed covers and curtains. She has been in this business for 16 years, and it has been profitable.

This is her third loan with the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She will use the income that generates to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by opening more boutiques and thereby become successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Verónica De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica forma parte del grupo de créditos Zhullin, vive por los alrededores de la vecina ciudad de Azogues, lugar de clima frió, esta ciudad tienen una característica especial ya que se encuentra asentada inclinada mente debido a su geografía, su gente es artesana muy hábiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Verónica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 7 y 3 años y un bebé de 7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Verónica desde hace algunos se dedica a la atención de su tienda, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, decidió  trabajar en esta actividad porque le da el espacio y el tiempo para poder cuidar de sus hijos y a su vez puede generar ingresos a su hogar.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres y otros artículos para su tienda de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad y así ampliar más su negocio. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por las charlas de educación que reciben en cada reunión y también porque con sus amigas sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo y conversar de varios temas de su interés.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in the neighboring area of the town of Azogues, a place with cold weather. This town has a unique feature, since it's located on an inclined ground surface due to its geography. Its inhabitants are very skilled artisans who still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Verónica is 29 years old and married. From her marriage she has conceived three children aged 7 and 3 years and a 7-month-old baby. Her eldest child goes to school and her husband works as an employee for a private company. She owns the house where she lives.

For the past few years Verónica has focused on her store. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a regular schedule. She decided to be in this line of work because it allows her to have the time and the space to care for her children, and also to get a source of income for her household.

She used her previous loan to purchase foodstuffs and other merchandise for her store, and she obtained a very good profit from that. She's once again requesting a loan in order to purchase products that are household staples and therefore expand her business. She enjoys her communal bank because of the lectures on education that they get on every meeting. Also, she enjoys it because by being with her friends, she takes a break from her daily work routine and talks about various subjects that interest her.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is a father of three. He is 32 years old.  His wife is a farmer. 

With the loan, he wants to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to boost rice production. The profits will be used to reinvest in the similar business.

----------------

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia  tiene la edad de 57 años, es casada y vive con el esposo y  dos hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Delia is 57-years old, married and lives with her husband and two children.  She wants the loan to purchase cattle.  When they are grown, she will sell them and earn a profit.  The cattle business will help her and her family to get ahead.  Delia hopes for her project to grow and to meet her goals so that in the future she can provide her family with a better quality of life and better financial stability.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Delia has not taken out other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan at better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 29 years old and married with two children. He farms livestock in Kangundo town. He also uses his livestock to  for ploug other farmers' land to make more income.

This being his second loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of livestock feed for his cows. 

Joshua will use the extra income to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to buy more livestock and become successful as a livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 48 years old married to Andrew.  She has run a grocery store business for the past 12 years.

Her monthly income is KES 20000.

Jackline has requested a loan of KES 30000 to purchase more grocery items to sell.  

This will be Jackline's first loan.  She will pay back the loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcatotoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Mujeres de Chilcatotoras está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, lugar que tiene amplias llanuras y verdes campos, su arquitectura es antigua y moderna. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al trabajo del campo como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura. La meta en común de este grupo es el mejorar  la estabilidad económica de sus hogares  para brindarles a sus familias un mejor futuro.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nelly, forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres de Chilcatotoras desde hace 2 años, en todo este tiempo ha logrado establecer una buena amistad con todas sus compañeras.

Doña Nelly tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 4 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Nelly trabaja de lunes a viernes en la limpieza de dos casas, esta actividad la está desempeñando desde hace 5 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa.

El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, cerdos y  alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es tener un criadero de cuyes más grande.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Chilcatotoras" communal bank is comprised of 10 women who live in the outskirts of the Tarqui parish in Cuenca, a place with wide plains and green fields, and an architecture that is both ancient and modern. Its inhabitants still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They do agricultural work such as raising animals and farming. This group's common goal is to improve the financial stability of their households so they can offer a better future for their families.

One of the members of this group is Nelly. She has been a part of the "Mujeres de Chilcatotoras" communal bank for the past two years. During all of this time she has succeeded in establishing a good friendship with all her fellow group members.

Nelly is 30 years old and married. From her marriage she has conceived three children aged 10, 7 and 4 years. They attend a small local school. She doesn't have a house of her own, which is why she lives in a relative's house.

Nelly works from Monday through Friday cleaning two houses. She has been in this line of work for the past five years. At home she raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and cattle. She also does farming work, and the crops she harvests are for her family's consumption.

She'll use the money from the loan to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and feed for her animals.

Her goal is to have a larger guinea pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, tiene la edad 69 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y el concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con le proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Víctor is 69-years old, married and lives with his wife.  He plans to use the loan to purchase some pigs and some feed to fatten them up.  He has some pigs already, and his plan is to give them concentrated feed to fatten them up more quickly.  He wants his animals to get to an ideal weight to sell them at the market or in neighboring areas.  He wants to earn as much profit as possible for his and his parents' well-being. He wants to grow his pig-raising business.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Victor has not previously taken out other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan at better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 43 years old.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past ten years.  

Donatha has requested a loan to buy more cassava and beans for sale. 

With the profits, Donatha will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy cassava and beans.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie, 37, is the mother of four school going children.

Pelagie has been selling carrots for the past ten years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more carrots to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy carrots to sell.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is a 36 year old married mother of two children.
