She has run a hair dressing salon for the past six years. 

With a loan, Laurence will be able to buy more shampoos and cutting machines for use in her salon. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more shampoos and cutting machines.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 36 years old. She has sold bananas for 13 years. 

With a loan, Janviere would like to buy more bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 63 years old. He has owned a pub for the past five years. 

With a loan, Faustin wants to buy more beer and sodas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas.

loans.name: Karabudiya

texts.en:
Karabudiya is 39 years old and married with two children. 

She sells a variety of items at the market. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to create savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jonhy Mauricio

texts.es:
Jonhy es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en casa de ellos el Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, trigo y papas ademas tiene a nimales de coral como gallinas, chanchos y vacas el credito solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, balanceados para los animales.

El credito le ayudado a comprar las cosas necesarias al contado y sean a bajo precio.

El sueño es tener dinero para tener una vida mejor y que los padres no se enfermen.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con lo padres.
texts.en:
Johny is single, does not have children and lives with his parents in their home in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.

Johny makes his living in agriculture.  He grows corn, wheat and potatoes.  In addition, he has barnyard animals like chickens, pigs and cows.  He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer and animal feed. 

The loan has helped Johny to pay cash for the things he needs, which gets him a lower price. 

His dreams are to have enough money for a better life and for his parents to not get sick. 

In his free time, Johny likes to take walks with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 54 years old, married to Alice and blessed with children who are now over 18 years old. He owns rental shops that he constructed 10 years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 50,000 from these shops. He has requested his first loan of KES 100,000 to purchase materials to renovate the shops. The profit he earns will aid him to build more shops to rent. He dreams of being a great businessman.

loans.use: To purchase materials to renovate his rental shops.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children, only one of whom attends school. She has a retail business and various items are sold in her boutique. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, potatoes and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell

loans.name: Fokognouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 47 ans et 05 enfants, les neuf  membres du groupe Fokognouma 3 de Samako vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à temps, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Sali (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande productrice d’arachide connue dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs  d’engrais, 2litres d’herbicide et utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour effectuer les travaux de labour. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 2,00ha, elle espère récolter 50 sacs d’arachide; Une partie de la production serait vendue pour contribuer à la prise en charge de certains besoins du foyer et le reste serait auto consommé en famille. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Sali a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Fokognouma 3 of Samako are married women living mainly in traditional extended families. On the average, they are 47 years of age, with five children. They all live in the village of Samako in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali) and know each other as neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage. With the goal of increasing their arable land and obtain agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] timely, they have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third agricultural loan. The group members will grow peanuts, millet, rice, gumbo [okra] and “niebe” [a type of black beans]. 

Mrs. Sali (the one seated on the far right in the photo) is known as a major peanut grower in her village and nearby region. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of fertilizers, two liters [0.5 gal] of herbicide and pay for male laborers’ work on the land. She buys agricultural inputs at the Bancoumana market. With a land plot of 2 ha [about 5 acres] she hopes to harvest 50 bags of peanuts. Part of the produce will be sold to provide for household needs, and the rest will be consumed by her own family. Just as other members of her group, Mrs. Sali has a goal of providing for her family’s nourishment thanks to this business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers (urea), herbicides and male laborers’ work.

loans.name: Poni Jada

texts.en:
Poni is a client of Finance Sudan. She is 40 years old. She has a foodstuff business that sells tomatoes, tomato paste, green pepper, onions and cooking oil among many other commodities and foodstuffs that she sells. 

She wants a loan to expand her business. This loan will help her improve her business and provide more foodstuffs to the people of the Munuki area in Juba South Sudan. She will also be uplifted in terms of her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, tomato paste, green pepper, onions and oil.

loans.name: Lubaga North United For Development Group

texts.en:
Steven is a small produce trader supplying a number of schools and other dealers in Kasubi, a Kampala City suburb. With seven children all in school, he doesn’t find time to rest because his financial needs are so demanding. 

He says that he wants his children’s major inheritance to be education and has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to boost his agricultural produce business since it's now harvest season in most areas. When he sells after the harvest is over, he will be able to make a big profit and overcome the challenges of inadequate capital. In turn, he will be able to meet his children's educational needs. He has enjoyed a lot from his small loans and says that due to his honest dealings with the micro finance providers, he has been able to keep on a progress track and he hopes that he will enjoy a good partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans for trade

loans.name: Dorian Andres

texts.es:
Dorian es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la albañeria el dinero lo solicita para la comprar de electrodomesticos como una television para la casa el dinero le ayudado a comprar la lavadora al contado para que le salga a un buen precio.

El sueño de Dorian tener siempre trabajo para tener dinero para vivir bien.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Dorian is single. He does not have children and lives with his parents in Chimbo in Bolivar Province.

He works in construction and is requesting money to buy home appliances, such as a television. The money also helped him to buy a washing machine, since he got a good deal by paying cash.  

Dorian’s dream is to always have work so that he will have money and can live well.

In his spare time he enjoys playing sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy home appliances, such as a washing machine.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 27 years old. She is married with two children. With this loan, she wants to buy more rice and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business as well as pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar for sale

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old with four children, ages between 11 and 20. Her husband works as a house builder. With this loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angélica  de 41 años de edad  trabaja  como empleada domestica en el cual tiene 20 años prestando  sus servicios,  ella  tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años que actualmente están estudiando, la Sra.  tiene  una construcción sin terminar,  su esposo y  ella  han  trabajado mucho para poder hacer este cuarto  pero  les  falto dinero para construir el techo, poner el yeso y pintura a la casa  es por eso que el día de hoy  están solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material que les hace falta , ellos  necesitan   habitar  ese cuarto ya que la  casa  es  muy pequeña y su familia ya esta  incomoda,  y su hijo adolecente de 17 años    ya  les está  pidiendo su cuarto para su privacidad. ella agradecerá el   apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica, 41 years old, has worked as a domestic employee for 20 years. She has two children, who are 17 and 12 years of age and who are currently in school.

Angélica has an unfinished construction project. She and her husband have been working hard to finish this room but they lack the money to build the roof and to plaster and paint their house. Consequently they are applying for a loan today so they can purchase the materials they need. 

They need to use that room because the house is very small and their family is uncomfortable. Her 17 year-old adolescent son has been asking them for his own room for privacy. She will appreciate the support provided.

loans.use: to finish construction on a room and to paint.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torrez de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas al día como comerciante de ropa y accesorios de vestir lo hace forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo.
El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital de trabajo ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos ya que ayuda con los pagos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Sara es tener su puesto de venta propio para ya no sufrir caminando ya que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a Impro y la primera vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sara is married and has a small child. They live in a house they own, occupying two small rooms. The house is located in the Ernesto Torrez area of the city of La Paz. Currently she works more than ten hours a day as a street vendor selling clothing and accessories because she does not have a fixed stall.

She needs a loan to increase her working capital because she wants to increase earnings since she helps to pay for her family’s food and basic services. 

Sara’s dream is to have her own stall so that she will not have to endure walking, which is very demanding, and so that she can improve her earnings.

This is the first time she has applied for a loan from Impro and from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, Irish potatoes, green peppers, fish, oil and beans

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 31-year-old mixed crop farmer. He also runs a food kiosk as well as sells cereals to supplement his income. He is married to Jane who helps him in farming. They are blessed with two children aged seven and four. James has been practicing farming for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

James is applying for his sixth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy dairy cattle. With the anticipated profit from the businesses, he will venture into the transport business. 

His hope is to be financially stable and be able to provide comfortably for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 33 years old. She sells various items in the business. Her husband works in the same business with her. She wants the loan to buy more rice and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice and soap to sell

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is 35 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past sixteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes such as shirts and skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes such as shirts and skirts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food items like tomatoes, eggs, onions, oranges and many others.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita  esta solicitando su tercer crédito ,  esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar telas  para  poder hacer uniformes ya que  viene la temporada  muy buena de que los  alumnos entraran  a la  escuela y  las   vecinas  de su colonia  le piden que les haga  los uniformes para sus hijos ya que es una señora con   mucha experiencia  en la costura , es  por eso que ella necesita el préstamo para poder invertir en telas, cierres, elásticos y más , ella  agradecerá  el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Benita is asking for her third loan. She is seeking a loan to buy fabrics so she can make uniforms. Students will be starting school soon and her neighbors in her community ask her to make uniforms for their children, since she is very experienced in sewing. That is why she needs this loan, so she can invest in fabrics, zippers, elastics, and more. She will be grateful for the support she receives.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 29 years old. She sells ladies clothes. With the loan, she wants to buy more ladies clothes such as Bitenge. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more ladies clothes to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan, es casado y tiene un hijo pequeño, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente presta servicios como abogado por mas de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de estudios superiores, ya que desea tomar un curso de actualización en su área y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cubrir los pagos.
El sueño de Jonathan es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a Impro y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Jonathan is married and has a small child, they live in the house they own, which is located in the Achumani zone in the city of La Paz. Currently, he works as a lawyer for more than ten hours a day, since he needs to pay for the food and the basic needs of his family. 

He is applying for this loan in order to pay for higher education studies, since he wishes to take a refresher course in his field, and the little money he earns is not enough to cover these expenses.

Jonathan's dream is to improve his income and his quality of life. This is his third loan with Impro and his first one with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for higher education refresher studies

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old and married to Beatrice.  They have two children aged seven and two.

Peter has a retail and serial shop in Nakuru which he has operated for the past eight years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to purchase float for his M-Pesa business (a mobile phone-based money transfer service).

He earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.  With the anticipated profit, he hopes to add more stock to his business and to open several M-Pesa shops in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase float for his M-Pesa business.

loans.name: Fokognouma 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Fokognouma 4 de Samako sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage; Dans le but d’avoir des intrants disponibles en début de la campagne agricole, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Sitan (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50kg de grains d’arachide de semence et utiliser l’association des jeunes du village pour effectuer les travaux de labour et de désherbage. Elle se ravitaille en semences à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 1,00ha, elle espère récolter 30 sacs d’arachide dont une partie serait vendue pour payer la scolarisation des enfants et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
Most of the ten female members of Fokognouma 4 Group of Samako are married and live in large traditional families. They average 37 years of age and three children. They all live in Samako, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali) and got acquainted through ties of kinship, marriage, and community

In order to have farm inputs available at the start of the planting season, they decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third farming loan. The members are going to grow peanuts, rice, okra, and black-eyed peas.

Mrs. Sitan (sitting on the left in the photograph) intends to use her loan to buy 50 kg of peanut seeds and hire the village's young people's association to carry out plowing and weeding work. She gets her supplies of seeds from the fair in Bancoumana.

With an area of one hectare, she intends to harvest 30 sacks of peanuts. One part will be sold to pay her children's school expenses, the other part will be consumed by her family.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds and hire male workers to carry out plowing and weeding work

loans.name: Fokognouma 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Fokognouma 5 de Samako sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage; Dans le but d’utiliser les engrais et les herbicides dans leurs parcelles de culture à temps pendant la saison pluvieuse, elles ont décidé d’intégrer au programme de SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil,  le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Kadiatou (femme debout  en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 litres d’herbicide, 4 sacs  d’engrais constitués d’urée et de complexe céréales.  Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 3,00ha, elle espère récolter 40 sacs d’arachide et 03sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes; Une partie de la production serait vendue en plus des fanes de niébé  pour assurer les besoins du foyer au quotidien et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
The women of Fokognouma 5 group from Samako are married, mostly in large traditional families, and are on average 41 years old with on average 3 children each. They all live in the village of Samako, in the Koulikoro area (the second largest administrative region of Mali), and they know one another through family links, marriage and local connections. 
With the goal of using fertiliser and weedkiller in their fields during the rainy season, they decided to join the credit programme at Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third cycle of agricultural loan. The group members are going to grow peanuts, cornmeal, rice, okra and cowpeas. Kadiatou (the woman standing third from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to purchase 2 litres of weedkiller, 4 bags of nitrogen fertiliser and some complex cereals. She buys her agricultural supplies in the Bancoumana market. With 3 hectares of land, she hopes to harvest 40 sacks of peanuts, 3 sacks of cornmeal, and 2 sacks of cowpeas with their top leaves. 
Part of the production will be sold, as well as the cowpea plant tops, in order to finance the family's daily requirements, and the rest will be eaten by the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and weedkiller.

loans.name: Fokognouma 6 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants, les neuf  membres du groupe Fokognouma 6 de Samako vivent toutes dans le village de Samako dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le riz, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Teneba (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande productrice d’arachide dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences d’arachide, 2L d’herbicide, 3 sacs  d’engrais constitués d’urée et de complexes céréales. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Bancoumana. Avec une superficie de 2,00ha, elle espère récolter 50 sacs d’arachide. Une partie de la production serait vendue pour participer à la prise en charge de certains besoins du foyer et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in large traditional families, on average 46 years old and with on average 3 children each, the nine group members of Fokognouma 6 all live in the village of Samako, in the Koulikoro area (the second largest administrative region of Mali), and they know one another through family links, marriage and local connections. 
With the goal of increasing their area under cultivation, they sought assistance from Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third cycle of agricultural loan. The group members are going to grow peanuts, rice, okra and cowpeas. Teneba (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is a significant peanut producer in the village. She plans to use her loan to purchase peanut seeds, 2 litres of weedkiller, and 3 bags of urea and grain compound fertiliser. She buys her agricultural supplies in the Bancoumana market. With 2 hectares of land, she hopes to harvest 50 sacks of peanuts.
Part of the production will be sold in order to help finance some of the household's daily requirements, and the rest will be eaten by the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, weedkiller and peanut seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    BENKADI 1 sont des hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à  KOLOKOBA, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Sory en position assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir : 1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 190 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi 1 Group are men averaging 45 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolokoba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI, and the previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mr. Sory (sitting in the middle) is growing corn. With his loan, he intends to pay for plowing and buy fertilizers to maintain one hectare. After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

He intens to turn a profit of XOF 190'000 (ca US$ 380) per planting. The profits will enable him to repay the loan and also take care of the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Christine est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Hodari», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 49 ans, veuve et mère de 11 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint fut décédé suite à une longue maladie d’infection pulmonaire. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers usagers. Elle installe ses articles au marché. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 ballons de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Christine is the leader of the "Hodari" business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 49 years old, a widow, and the mother of 11 children - all in education. Her husband died following a long battle with lung disease. She is a seller of secondhand shoes. She displays her goods in the market, having started her business with a loan from Hekima. She will use this new loan to buy three bales of shoes. Thus, she hopes to grow her business, educate and feed her children, and build a fine house.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy three bales of shoes.

loans.name: Go/03173 Group

texts.fr: La cliente Namwezi est membre du collectif  d’affaire  « Esther», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un préfet des études dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle installe ses produits au marché, parfois a son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il ya 11 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de poissons salés. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Namwezi is a member of the "Esther" business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 45 years old, married and the mother of 10 children who are all in education. Her husband has a teaching role in a public school, and she is a fish seller. She displays her products at the market and sometimes also at her home. She started her business with her own capital received from her husband, eleven years ago. She will use this new loan to buy four bags of dried fish. Thus, she wants to grow her business, educate and feed her children, and build a fine house.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of salted fish.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en: Janvier is 38 years old. He sells used shoes and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He wants the loan to buy more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food items such as tomatoes, Irish potatoes, black pepper and onions.

loans.name: Karagwe Group

texts.en: Harriet is a member of the Karagwe group. She resides in the Ntungamo district. Harriet has a retail shop, which is located within the cell where she lives. Her major challenge is a lack of capital for her business. She has applied for 500,000 UGX to buy various items for her shop. She also hopes to use some of the money to pay the school fees for her children. Harriet is glad that she has an institution like UGAFODE to borrow from since it helps her restock the  shop. In the photograph, the group is with their loan officer.

loans.use: To buy various items for her shop.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 61 years old. He sells potatoes and has been in the business for 20 years. He is married with five children; four of them go to school. With the loan, he wants to buy more potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 32 years old. She is married with two children, only one goes to school.  She has sold clothes for the past four years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a single mother of four children and a business lady dealing in secondhand items. She has been in this business for two years now because she had no money to venture into new commodities. Yet there were these items from people moving and others who were disposing of their items at a cheap price.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 for a period of 12 months. She wants to buy more stock of used items to expand her business to meet the increasing demand from her clients. She intends to use the profits to pay back the loan and build a house for her family in the near future, this will help her save the money she has been spending on rent. She is a hard working and innovative lady.

In the photo is the client and the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy used items to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio de 47 años de edad, casado, del municipio de Chinandega, es propietario de un triciclo y venta de verduras y frutas en su casa donde habita. En el servicio de triciclo tiene clientes fijos que son los comerciantes que se trasladan desde muy temprano diariamente a sus negocios. Inicio como cadete en otro triciclo alquilado y luego con sus ganancias que obtuvo, tomo la idea de comprar su propio triciclo ya que vio que era rentable brindar este servicio a los pobladores de la localidad y visitantes.   Reynaldo esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de llantas, pintura y carpa, para darle mantenimiento a su triciclo y asi brindarles un mejor servicio a los usuario, asi de esta manera ir mejorando cada dia sus ingresos, ya que es el quien se encarga de la manutención del hogar y su familia.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio is 47 years old, married, and lives in the municipality of Chinandega. He owns a bike taxi and works selling fruits and vegetables from his home. He has regular customers of his bike taxi service, usually businessmen and women who he transports to their work very early in the morning each day. He started out as a rookie on another rented bike and later, with his earnings, he got the idea to purchase his own as he saw that providing this service to local residents and visitors was a good source of income. Reynaldo is requesting a loan in order to purchase tires, pain, and an awning in order to maintain his bike taxi and thus provide better service to his customers. This way he can go on each day improving his earnings, as he is the one responsible for providing for his home and his family.

loans.use: purchase paints, tires, and an awning for his bike taxi.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a Peruvian artisan who creates beautiful sculptures with natural Andean gemstones. He plans to buy stones and other raw materials he needs to increase production.

Cesar has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have worked as a stone carver since 1988. Of my four children, my oldest girl shows the most interest in my art and even assists me. I work with serpentine, rose manganese, calcite, celestite, red jasper, mottramite, chrysocolla, rhodochrosite and quartz. I work in stone because of the beautiful things that can be made with each kind. I like stone's naturalness and purity of color."

"To all of you who are assisting me with this loan, I send you blessings. You are helping make it possible for me to increase my sales and provide a better future for my children, which is my greatest desire. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Cesar's natural gemstone sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3600

loans.use: to buy stones and other raw materials he needs to increase production.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a Mexican artisan who carries on his family tradition of handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories. He would like to invest in wool and also be able to offer work to his artisan friends and neighbors.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I am the fourth generation in a family dedicated to Zapotec weavings. I remember as a child watching my father working on the loom while my mother and grandmother carded and dyed the wool. We shear the fleece, spin it and dye it with tints from the cochineal insect, pomegranate peel, bark from the huajal tree that thrives here, as well as oak and pecan bark. Stones, dried flowers, almost all the rocks and flowers here yield natural colors. My wife and I work together in our home. We help each other, and in this way we can finish our rugs sooner. I especially like diamond motifs, as they represent a kind of maguey coat of arms seen at Monte Albán. They exemplify my Zapotec heritage."

"First of all, I want to thank all of you who help fund these microcredits, which benefit people like my family and me. You are making it possible for us to continue the work we love. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Alberto's traditional handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4559

loans.use: to invest in wool and also be able to offer work to his artisan friends and neighbors.

loans.name: Sirley

texts.es:
Sirley, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo uno esta en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de su suegra ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja vendiendo frutas en un puesto en la acera de una calle comercial soportando los cambios de clima en compañía de su bebe ya que tampoco tiene con quien dejarlo,y con lo poco que gana debe ayudar a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El credito lo requiere para el aumento de su mercadería ya que con eso podrá mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Sirley es tener su puesto propio para no sufrir en la calle y posteriormente adquirir una casa en anticretico para brindar  mas comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sirley is married and has two children, one of whom is school aged.  They live in her mother-in-law's house in three rooms with brick walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the Alto San Antonio area of the city of La Paz.  

She currently works selling fruits on the sidewalk of a commercial street, dealing with weather changes in company of her baby, since she doesn't have anyone to leave him with.  With the little she earns, she is able to cover the costs of food, education, and basic utilities for her family.   

She is requesting this loan to increase her merchandise since this will improve her income and her quality of life.  Sirley's dream is to have her own stall so that she does not have to suffer on the street, and later to obtain a pre-paid rental home to provide more comfort and security to her family. 

This is the second time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha vive con su esposo en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. La pareja se dedica al comercio de autos usados llegando a vender tres autos al año ya que el mercado esta muy saturado. Bertha necesita el crédito para poder hacer la compra de un auto en mejor estado para poder tener mejores ganancias de el y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Bertha es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para abrir un taller mecánico y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha lives with her husband in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  They work selling used cars.  They sell about three cars a year since the market is very saturated.  Bertha is requesting this loan to purchase a car in better condition so that they can earn more income and cover their household expenses.

Bertha's dream is to save enough money to open an auto repair shop and have more income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Gune Vicky

texts.en: Gune Vicky is a client of Finance Sudan. She is a businesswoman who has the potential to grow very much because her client base is growing. She is taking out a loan to help her buy more stock for her clothing business, like dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts and baby clothes.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothing like dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts and baby clothes.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofe  se dedica al cultivo de verduras y a su posterior venta en el mercado Rodriguez de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la Localidad de Rio Abajo Comunidad El Palomar del Departamento de La Paz.
Necesita crédito  para incrementar su capital, o sea, comprar semilla mejorada para  que sus productos sean  mas llamativos para el comprador.

El sueño de Cleofe es tener vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Cleofe works planting vegetables and later selling them at the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz.  She lives in her parents house, in two rooms with brick walls and a cement floor, in the El Palomar community of Rio Abajo town in the department of La Paz.

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital and purchase better seeds so that products will be more attractive to buyers.  Cleofe's dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase better seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    BENKADI 2 sont des hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à  KOLOKOBA, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Lamissa en position debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les  intrants et  semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 185 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi 2 Group are men averaging 45 years of age and five children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolokoba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mr. Lamissa (standing in the middle in the photograph) is growing corn. With his loan, he intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

He intends to turn an average profit of XOF 185'000 (ca US$ 370) per planting. This profit will enable him to repay the loan and cover the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Sinignessigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 1 sont des hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Siaka debout en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 290 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignessigui 1 group are married men with an average age of 45 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Siaka, standing second from the left in the picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of 3 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make a profit of 290 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to cover his family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose from Liberia. She lives in Gbarnga, which is the capital city of Bong County and located in the center of the country. The majority of people here are farmers growing crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.
 
Rose is 39 years old and married with 3 children. Her oldest child is 13 and her youngest child is 8. All of them are currently living at home and in school. Rose owns a cook shop where she sells fufu (cassava-based dough), dough, rice and soup for the past seven years now. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase fufu, cassava, fish, meat and rice, etc. for her business.
 
On average, she works 13 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by bus.  She cites her small income as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of the business is the buying. In the future, she would like to build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fufu, cassava, fish, meat and rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
This is Baby from Liberia. She lives in Gbarnga, which is the capital city of Bong County located in the center of the country. The majority of people here are farmers, growing crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava. Baby is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Her oldest child is 13 and her youngest child is 6. All of them are currently living at home and going to school. 
 
Baby owns a market table where she has been selling oil, rice, vita and pepper, etc. for the past 3 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase oil, rice, vita and pepper, etc. On average, she works 9 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites her small income as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the buying. In the future, she would like to build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, vita and pepper, etc.

Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Salifou debout en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les intrants et  semences agricoles pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of Djantoyerela 1 Group are men averaging 43 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in Niantanso, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mr. Salifou (second one from the left in the standing row) is growing corn. With his loan, he intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain two hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

He intends to turn an average profit of XOF 300'000 (ca US$ 600) per planting. This profit will enable him to repay the loan and cover the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Djantoyerela  A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA  A  sont des hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.

lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.

Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 500 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Alassane, standing second from the right in the picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make a profit of 500 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to cover his family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is from Kyabashenyi in the Ntungamo District. He is married and has 5 children. They are 13, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years old. Four of them go to school. In addition to his family, Dickson has to take care of his mother who lives nearby. He is a coffee and banana farmer. 

His challenge has been the extra cost of transport, because he has been hiring a motorcycle to transport his coffee to the buyers. He has now applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy a motorcycle to assist in the business. In the photograph are Dickson and his wife.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to help him transport his produce.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
This is Lucrecia from Liberia. She lives in Gbarnga, which is the capital city of Bong County located in the center of the country. The majority of people here are farmers growing crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava. 

She is 38 years old and unmarried with seven children. Her children's ages are between 19 and 14. All of them are currently living at home and in school.  

Lucrecia has been selling shortbread for the past 3 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase flours, sugar, baking powder and yeast, etc. for her business. 
 
On average, Lucrecia works 9 hours a day at her business. She started her business by selling for her mother. She transports her merchandise by bus. She cites small capital as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the buying. In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase flours, sugar, baking powder and yeast, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Djantoyerela  B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA  B sont des hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
lls sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr ADAMA NOTIAN assis à l'extrême droite. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 200 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.

The members of the Djantoyerela B group are men with an average age of 45 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Niantanso, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Adama Notian, sitting on the far right in the picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make a profit of 200 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to cover his family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline, 55 years old, is widowed and the mother of two children. Right now, Evangeline is into selling bananas in their village. She usually earns a net income of PHP 200 per day. She is taking out a loan PHP 12,000 to buy more bananas to sell. She hopes to continue to improve her business, in order to earn more income and to achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is 58 years old. He and his family live have been residing recently in the village of Paniki. He is a farmer who cultivates their farmland by planting rice and vegetables for sale. He was also engaged in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. He and his wife are aiming for a successful life, in order to cover the needs of their children. For this purpose, Oscar plans to raise more pigs to sell, but he has limited capital. He decided he wants to take out a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to sell. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business, and he hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to sell.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en: Krubo is 54 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. They have five children aged from 13 to 34, only two of whom are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hard-working person. For the past three years, she has been selling flour, sugar and other goods in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She uses the bus to get her goods to her table. She is applying for a loan to buy more flour, sugar and other goods for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, which enables small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 36 years old and lives at the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and she has two children aged 16 and 7, who are in school and live at home. Sarah described herself as a hardworking person. For the past seven years she has been running a cook shop in the local market where she sells rice and soup. She likes her business because of the way the customers buy from her. 

She started this business with money given to her by husband. Sarah walks every day to buy her ingredients, since her shop is very close to the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bushmeat, onions and coal, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, enabling small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bushmeat, onions and coal,  etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jannebah

texts.en: Jannebah is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married. She was unable to go to school and has four children between 8 and 28 years old. They are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hard-working woman. For the past 15 years, she has been selling door locks, hinges, door catches, nails and other goods in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 AM to 5 PM. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business location. She is applying for a loan to buy more door locks, hinges, door catches, nails and other goods for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, door catches, nails and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a high school literature teacher since 1998. Her husband is a carpenter who makes and sells furniture on his own. Their children both go to high school. The house they live in has vulnerable walls and, during the winter time, strong winds and frosts chill the family members down to their cores. So she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, fiberglass and foam. Installing vacuum windows and insulating their walls with fiberglass and foam will ensure that the house will no longer lose its heat through its windows and walls. More importantly, the family will began to burn less coal for heating, which will have a positive impact on the efforts against air pollution, because there will be less release of carbon dioxide. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who cares deeply about her family.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, fiberglass and foam to insulate the walls of her home.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA   sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme KIATOU fait le commerce de laitue et d’oignon dans ce groupe de femmes de      KOTOGNOGONTALA. Elle se tient  assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 28 paniers de laitue par mois, 3 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala group are married women with an average age of 36 and, on average, 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is their 14th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, which they are requesting in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs.

Kiatou is the Kotognogontala group member who sells lettuce and onions. She is sitting on the left in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 28 baskets of lettuce, per month, and three 50-kilo bags of onions, which she will resell for cash locally, with her family, to a retail clientèle mainly composed of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty was born in 1972. She has three children. One of them is disabled. The other two study at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. He earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Ty grows rice. She has done this job for a long time. She earns about 2,000,000 VND per month, so her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. Ty’s challenges in life and work are lack of capital to invest in her business and lack of knowledge about how to raise her children. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and be successful in business. This loan is one of the steps that can help her reach her dream. She can invest in her business to gain earnings and save the profits for her children’s education. Ty is a hard-working woman and a passionate businesswoman. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA's microfinance program. In her first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy wood for her husband’s carpentry workshop. 
Other members of Ty's group include the following: 
Thom is 31 years old. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do carpentry. 
Hong is 32 years old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do carpentry. 
Phuong is 42 years old. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do carpentry. 
Hong is 31 years old. She has four children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband's carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en: Yom, 57, is a mother of eight kids. Currently only three children are under her responsibility, as they are still in school. She and the rest of her family live in the Sampov Meas District of Pursat Province, where her agribusiness is located, farming rice on two hectares. Having been with this business for ages, she is able to generate about 18,100 KHR per day to cover the daily cost of living. This is the sixth loan for Yom from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have enabled her to strengthen her business over time and to earn a good income. Now, she is the leader of a group of three borrowers. Out of the group’s 2,800,000 KHR loan, 1,400,000 KHR is Yom’s portion. As the leader, she will spend her portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer and to lease additional farmland. Moreover, she will spend part to buy two pigs, as well as pig feed, and five chickens to raise. She hopes she can earn more income, so she can run a small business for the benefit of her kids.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer, to lease additional farmland, and to buy pigs, pig feed and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Ngoub's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, Ngoub is 37 and a married mother of two children. Her main sources of income are from rice cultivation and pig-raising, through which she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day to support herself and the entire family. Ngoub has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four cycles and has fully repaid back her past loans. The past loans have enabled her to earn a decent income and to expand her farm. Now, she is the leader of a group of three. She will spend her portion of the loan to hire labor to plow her farm. She hopes that she can prepare her land and plant her crop on time and receive yields.

loans.use: to hire labor to plow her farm.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 36 years old. She has three children. Two of them are attending school, in the fifth and eighth grades. The other one is still little. Her husband earns his living as a carpenter. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thuy goes to the market to sell cinnamon. She earns 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is a lack of knowledge of how to do business. She wishes she would have a modern house in the future. This loan will help her attain this dream. She can invest in her business to earn more. Thuy is a hard-working woman. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA's microfinance program. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more cinnamon to sell. 
Other members who are part of Thuy's group include the following: 
Dung is 51 years old. She has three children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell dogs and cats as pets in a market. 
Huong is 32 years old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for carpentry. 
Hong is 35 years old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for carpentry. 
Lien is 29 years old. She has two children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy more cinnamon to sell.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: Clemente es un hombre de 43 años , está casado con Isabel y tiene 3 hijas, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Clemente tiene un taller de reparación para vehículos tanto pequeños como pesados en donde  realiza trabajos de mecánica. Gracias a esta labor logró sacar adelante a su familia y le permitió ahorrar para poner una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles en donde su esposa es la encargada y ofrece a sus clientes bebidas heladas como gaseosas y algunos víveres que tienen mayor demanda. Desempeña esta labor en el primer piso de su vivienda y logro habilitarlo de a pocos. Tiene en mente seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio porque ayuda a la economía familiar al igual que su trabajo como mecánico. Es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y se siente muy contento por contar con la confianza de su entidad financiera. Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles y  comprar herramientas para su taller tales como desarmadores, martillos, repuestos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Clemente is 43-years-old and married to Isabel. They have three children who live with them in their home.  

Clemente is a mechanic with an auto repair shop and where he works on everything from small cars to large trucks. His business has provided for his family and allowed Clemente to save the money for a small grocery store that his wife runs. She sells cold drinks, such as soda, and some of the highest-selling household items. The store is in the first floor of the family's home and Clemente and Isabel have managed to fix it up a little. 

Clemente wants to keep striving to improve the repair shop as it helps the family finances and supports his work as a mechanic. This is the second time Clemente has requested a loan and he's very pleased to have the lender's trust. He hopes to receive 3,000 new soles to purchase spare parts for his shop, as well as tools such as screwdrivers, hammers, and others.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts, screwdrivers, hammers, and other tools.

loans.name: Vanchig

texts.en: Mr. Vanchig is 58 years old lives with his wife in a ger (traditional felt tent) in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Horjmoo is 56 years old and retired last year. She stays home and takes care of her husband. Their children are all married and live apart from them. Vanchig has been running a taxi business in town for years, and he has his own spot and regular clients. He is now applying for a loan of 400,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car, in order to continue his business without interruption. He is hard-working, diligent and positive person.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car to continue his taxi business without interruption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to start his hand- crafting of traditional nomadic tents.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 34 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, casada, ama de casa y agricultora desde hace muchos años con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa gracias al apoyo de sus padres que fueron quienes le enseñaron y le apoyaron para que ella pudiese estudiar. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar papa, maíz, frijol, café, entre otros ya que en su familia es una tradición la cual practican hace muchas generaciones pero principalmente la papa. Sus clientes son las personas que venden en el mercado municipal de la zona donde ella habita. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos menores trabajan es propia y está ubicada a 1 hora con 30 minutos trasladándose a pie diariamente. 

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de semilla de papa certificada, abono, fertilizantes entre otros, para poder cultivar y cosechar un producto de calidad y atractivo para su clientela.

Sus planes y sueños son los de seguir construyendo un patrimonio sólido para sus hijos, que ellos puedan tener una tierra donde vivir y donde trabajar como también hacerle unas mejoras a su casa de habitación como el  repello.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been a housewife and farmer for many years. She has a primary school education thanks to the support of her parents who taught her and supported her so that she could study. Her parents were the ones who taught her to farm potatoes, corn, beans, coffee, and other crops since many generations of her family have been farmers, mainly potato farmers. 

Her customers are the people to whom she sells in the community market in the zone where she lives. She owns the land on which she, her husband, and her young children work, and they walk 1 hour and 30 minutes a day to get there. 

She has requested a loan from the group COMIXMUL to buy certified potato seeds, manure, fertilizer, and other things to be able to plant and harvest a quality, attractive product for her customers.

Her plans and dreams are to continue building wealth for her children so that they will have land where they can live and work, and also to improve her home with plaster.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción 41  años  de edad,   vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace  06  años al negocio de venta de golosinas, pan y tamales su venta es de forma ambulante.
Doña Asunción sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario ella visita y que le visitan en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora que desea salir adelante y es un ejemplo de trabajo y de superación. 
Doña Asunción está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pataste, yuca, papas, cebolla, chiles, harina, maíz, leña, carne de pollo, res, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es su sexto  préstamo que solicita.
Doña Asunción su sueño es mejor su  negocio 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Asunción, 41 years old, lives with her husband and their three children. For the past six years she has dedicated herself to the sale of snack foods, bread, and tamales. She does not have a fixed post from which she sells.

Asunción's clients are her friends and others who visit her daily. She is a very hardworking woman and wants very much to get ahead. She is a great example of someone who does everything in her power to do so. 

Asunción is asking for this loan in order to buy chayote, yucca, potatoes, onions, chilies, flour, corn, firewood, chicken, beef, etc. for her business. With the help of this loan she will be able to improve the business, and as a result her quality of life as well. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma, as this is the 6th loan she will be receiving from the institution. Asunción's dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy chayote, yucca, potatoes, onions, chilies, flour, corn, firewood, chicken, beef, etc. for her business

loans.name: Musy

texts.es: Musy tiene 22 años, es soltera, y vive en la casa de su familia junta sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Musy se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas al por mayor o por unidades. Tiene una refrigeradora donde diariamente congela las bebidas que vende a sus clientes. Trabaja sola desde hace 1 año. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales  y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, además le agrada la independencia financiera que tiene. Desea convertirse en una prospera empresaria y tener un local amplio para desarrollar mejor su actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.1000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. Además se siente segura trabajando con los miembros de su banco comunal ya que ha observado que es un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado comprará más bebidas de diversas marcas y presentaciones para complacer el gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Musy is 22 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents and two siblings. She sells cold soft drinks on both a wholesale and individual basis. She has a refrigerator where every day she cools the drinks that she sells to her clients. She has been working on her own for the past year. Musy likes this business as it has enabled her to have her own income with which she covers her personal expenses, and she is able to support her parents with their home expenses as well. She really values the degree of independence having her own income has provided. 

Musy would like to become a prosperous businesswoman and someday have a larger location from which she can develop her business. Currently, Musy is asking for a loan of S/. 1,000, and she is grateful for all of those people who make it possible for her to receive this loan that she needs to improve her business. Musy feels very supported working with the other members of her lending group, since there is a lot of group solidarity. With the amount that she is asking for, Musy will buy more drinks of various types in order to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell to her clients

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos. Marcia se dedica a la venta de hielos, gaseosas y chupetes de diversos sabores elaborados con frutas tropicales. Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, ahí conserva a bajas temperaturas todos los productos que ofrece. Ha hecho esta actividad por más de 1 año, trabaja sola atendiendo a sus clientes de manera cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, además puede contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de continuar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. 
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de gaseosas y frutas de la región para elabore chupetes y continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Marcia is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents, siblings, and small children. She works selling ice cream, sodas, and ice pops that she makes using various tropical fruits. She has her own refrigerator that she purchased with her savings, which is where she stores all of her goods to be sold. She has worked selling these items for the past year, and works alone attending her clients very cordially. Marcia enjoys having this business as it allows her to work from home and be able to take care of her children. She also is able to earn the income she needs to support her home expenses. Her plan is to continue to grow her business and increase the variety of products that she sells. 

At the moment, Marcia is asking for a loan of S/. 500. She is very happy to know that she can count on this financial support. She plans to use this loan to purchase more sodas and local fruits, in order to make more ice pops and continue her work. She is very dedicated to complying with the repayments of this loan when they are due.

loans.use: to buy sodas and fruits to continue her drink and ice-pop business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 34 años, está casada con Rogelio con quien tiene dos hijos, juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe. Olga tiene una tienda de productos comestibles desde hace 8 años y este es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Cuando comenzó con su negocio uso los pocos ahorros que tenía para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros lo cual le sirvió para obtener sus primeras ganancias y surtir su negocio, actualmente tiene mas productos. Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo porque con el tiempo se ha convertido en una vecina muy querida y conocida. Dedica el fruto de su trabajo a sus hijos a quienes siempre los envía al colegio y evita que pasen necesidades. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es construir su vivienda  a base de material noble para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar productos comestibles tales como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, paquetes de gaseosa y cereales porque son los productos que tiene mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old and has two children with her husband Rogelio. They live in an adobe house. 

Olga has owned a grocery store for the past 8 years and this is her family's main source of income. When she started her business, she used the small amount of money that she had saved to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and other things that generated her first profits, which she used to stock the store. She currently has more products.

She is very happy with her business because, with time, it has become a very dear and well-known neighborhood store. She dedicates the fruit of her labor to her children, who she always sends to high school and makes sure they do not suffer.

One of her long-term goals is to build her home with better materials to improve her quality of life.

This is her second Kiva loan and she is thankful for the financial support that she has received to continue her business. She promises to make her payments on time.

She requests 4,000 nuevos soles to buy food products like bags of rice, bags of sugar, and boxes of soda and cereal because these products are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, soda, and cereal.

loans.name: Sobre Ruedas Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal Sobre Ruedas de Villarrica, Región de la Araucanía de Chile, se ubica este Banco Comunal en el cual sus socios tienes rubros como colectivos y venta de frutas y verduras, Florencio, que está ubicado al extremo derecho de la foto con su mano en el bolsillo y sweater verde, se dedica a la venta de provisiones y frutas. Comenzó hace 6 años con su negocio, porque antes trabajo como maestro carpintero, pero la gente no fue constante con los pagos de los trabajos que hacía, así que prefirió colocar un negocio más rentable y en donde pudiera estar más tiempo con su señora, así que se consiguió dinero y pudo empezar con su negocio, compro maquinas y hasta pudo acceder a comprarse una camioneta para el traslado de la mercadería que compraba, pero él necesita dinero para comprar más mercadería e insumos para su negocio. Espera que tenga una buena venta, ya que tiene su clientela, y lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajara junto a Fondo Esperanza es la ayuda monetaria que dan ya que así puede optar a tener algo seguro de dinero y contar con ello para comprar la mercadería que necesita.
texts.en:
